True to his word as soon as Bolin was all patched up he got right to teaching Korra the basics of Pro-Earthbending, which she of course proved to be a natural at. "Man you're picking this up quick!" he said impressed by her progress. "Got to admit I'm a little jealous. It took me a week to get this good."

"What can I say? Bending just comes naturally to me." she said a little smug, before remembering her frustrating lack of progress in Airbending. "I wish my Airbending came to me just as naturally."

"What's wrong with your Airbending? If you don't mind me asking."

"*Sigh* Ever since I was a kid I could bend Water, Earth and Fire easily, but no matter how hard I try I've never been able to produce a single puff of air. I thought when I moved to Air Temple Island to train with Tenzin I would finally be able to Airbend, but still nothing." She then sat on the floor with her knees tucked into her chest a little depressed after baring her soul.

Bolin was heartbroken seeing such a woman who normally looked like she was ready and able to take on the world in such a sorry state. He racked his brain to try and think of a way to cheer her up. He snapped his fingers when an idea came to him, he didn't know if it would work but he had to try.
11513.title: Back to reality.

choices: Go sight seeing.(They might just meet some interesting people on the way)
Go to a club and dance the night away.
Skip all that and head straight for a Love Motel.
115131.content:
"Let's get out of here and have some fun!" he said with big smile.

"What? Why?" Korra asked confused.

"Because the night is still young, I've got some money I've been saving up and most importantly we both could use some fun." he reasoned.

"But..what would we even do?"

"Whatever we want! Come on Korra let's paint this town red!" He didn't give her much time to ask any further questions as he dragged her out of the gym to hit the streets. At first Korra was very unsure about all this but she quickly warmed up to the idea when Bolin took her to his favorite eatery which was famous for it's authentic Water Tribe food.

"So..what do you think?" Bolin asked Korra who was happily chowing down on a bowl of noodles.

"It's delicious! I didn't think I could miss Water Tribe grub so soon." she said with a hint of nostalgia.

"And this is but a taste of what this city has to offer. No pun intended." he said before continuing to enjoy his own meal.

"Why did you ask me out all of the sudden anyway? Or to be more accurate kidnap me." she said jokingly.

"Well..I just couldn't stand seeing you sad. If I could help you figure out how to Airbend I would, but since I can't I went with the best thing I could think of." he answered sincerely.

A slight blush appeared on her face and warmth filled her heart at hearing this. She smiled sweetly "Thank you Bolin."

He had a smile and blush of his own as he rubbed the back of neck awkwardly "So..how are you liking Republic City so far?" he asked.

"Well..to be honest my first impression was pretty mixed. I ended up getting arrested." she frowned thinking about her rather unpleasant encounter with Lin Beifong.

Bolin's eye's widened in disbelief "Really?! For what?"

"I stopped a group of thugs from tearing up a helpless shopkeepers store. But did Beifong listen me when I explained it to her? No! She just treated me like a criminal for no reason!" Just thinking about that woman made Korra's blood boil a little.

From what Bolin knew about Chief Beifong she was tough as nails and scary, but fair and professional. She must of had a good reason right? "Well how did you stop these thugs?" he asked.

Korra had a smirk on her face as she remember teaching those thugs a lesson "Oh it was great! Their leader tried to throw a water spear at me, but I threw it back at him freezing his face and kicked him into their car! Before this other guy could even try to Earthbend I launched him into the air with an earth column and he fell into a fruit stand! The last guy tried to fry me but I powered through the fire and tossed him through a shops..window."

Her voice lost some of it's vigor as she started to realize just how much damage she really caused in her scuffle with The Tripe Threats. "And before they could get away I sent their car crashing into another..shop." Remembering that last bit really drove it home. She was lucky nobody else was in that shop.

"Oof." Bolin said with a grimace.

"Plus I may have tried to run from the police and injured a couple of them before I was caught." she said embarrassed as she remembered kicking one guy in the face and causing another to ram into a wall of ice.

"Oooof."

"Yeah. Thinking about it now I guess she had plenty of reasons to treat me like a criminal." she said sheepishly.

"I'll say! Nobody is above the law with Chief Beifong. I'm honestly amazed your not in jail. Um, no offense."

"None taken. But yeah she was ready to lock me up and throw away the key, luckily Tenzin was there to bail me out. *Sigh* Some Avatar I am huh? I try to help people and all I end up doing is causing trouble." she said self deprecatingly.

"Hey, none of that!" he said sternly before saying warmly "You stood up to a group of bullies single handedly to protect innocents. I say that not only makes you a great Avatar but great person over all."

Her blush returned and she shyly played with one of her side pony tails "You really think so?"

"Of course! Sure you messed up a little but you'll get better. And hey if you ever need any help in saving people, don't hesitate to give me a call! I'll drop whatever I'm doing and come running!" he said sincerely.

She knew he meant every word, but felt like she needed to test him a little. "Really?" she asked raising an amused eyebrow "Being The Avatar means I'll most likely face against all sorts of danger. Are you sure you're up for it?"

Bolin crossed his arms with a confident grin "You better believe it."

"Okay, but if we end up facing the end of the world together don't say I didn't warn you." They shared a good laugh at that even though they both knew the possibility was very real.

"And to tell you the truth, I'm a bit of a criminal myself." he confessed.

Now Korra's eye's widened in disbelief "No way!"

"Way." Bolin's face turned solemn as he thought back to some of his darker years "It happen a few years after our parents were killed. We lived on the streets for the most part, it was rough, but we managed, barely. Then one day, one of the Triple Threats came walking down the ally we were sleeping in for the night, I guess he saw some easy cheap labor in us and we were desperate at the time, so when he offered us some work we accepted. Mako helped with book keeping and money management, he was always good with numbers. And I was strong for my age so I helped with cargo. They worked us hard and we saw some..unpleasant things while working for them. But we had a roof over our heads and decent meals for the first time in what felt like forever, so we just kept at it. Doing what we had to do to survive."

Korra could feel her heart breaking the more she heard, she never could have imagined how someone could've gone though all that and still be so sweet and full of life. "Bolin." she said softly.

"It's alright, this story has a happy ending! Or at least it will soon." He said with a big smile returning to his face. "When we saw that Pro-Bending could give us the opportunity to go straight and make some serious money, we saved every little penny we could and when we were finally old enough to compete, we left The Triple Threats and never looked back! And now The Fire Ferret's are well on their way to becoming the first rookie team in Pro-Bending history to become Champions!" he exclaimed triumphantly while flexing his muscles like a body builder for maximum cool factor, only to accidentally spill his drink all over the table. "Oh geez, I'm sorry!"

Korra chuckled heartily at his silliness "It's fine Bolin, don't worry about it." she said happily as she helped him clean up.

After recovering from that embarrassment Bolin then said "So anyway, what do you say we put all that heavy stuff behind us and focus on the here and now! Because we still got a whole night of debauchery ahead of us, so lets finish our meal and get back to it!"

"Yeah!" she wholeheartedly agreed "This city's not going to know what hit it!"

With a city as big as Republic city there was all kinds of things to do, especially at night if you know where to look. So the only question was what would the young benders do next?
115131.title: A nice dinner with a fellow "criminal".

choices: Only to be ran over by a lovely young woman on her moped.
He makes it back home and dreams of his fair Avatar.
1151312.content:
After finishing their meal the young couple went to a nearby soda bar to share a few drinks, which then turned into a burping contest much to the chagrin of the other patrons, but they didn't care about what others thought, they were having fun and that was all that matters. They then went to Harmony Tower to really take the sights of the city, or to be more accurate Korra was taking in the sights while Bolin was mostly watching her. It made him so happy that he accomplished what he set out to do with this sudden date, even more happy then his victory in the ring earlier. Seeing Korra in such high spirits and having a good time was more rewarding then having a crowd of a million fans cheering his name.

Not long after they went to a night club still filled with people dancing to some smooth tunes. This was when Korra started to feel a little unsure again because she never really danced before and with so many people there she didn't want to make a fool of herself.

"Hey, what's the matter?" Bolin asked noticing her not have fun.

"Well..I know it's silly but..I've never really danced before. To be honest before I came to Republic City I never really did much else but train." she explained. "So this whole night has been quite the experience for me."

"Good or bad?"

"Good, great even! This is night has been the most fun I've had in a long time." she said sincerely as she rubbed her arm shyly "I just don't want to ruin it with my lack of dancing skills."

"That's what you're worried about?" he asked with relief now knowing Korra was still having fun. She was just a little shy when it came to dancing apparently, surprising given her usually confident attitude but it was nothing he couldn't fix. "Korra, look at most of the people here, do they look like expert dancers to you?" he asked gesturing to the crowd.

She did as he said and sure enough most of the people in the club like amateurs, not good but not bad either. Although one guy looked like he was having a stroke rather then dancing.

"No?" she answered unsure where he was going with this.

"Do they look like they care if they're expert dancers?"

She looked looked back at the crowd and noticed that just about everyone here was having a blast in spite of their lack luster skills.

"No." she said with a little more of her usual confidence.

"And I don't care if you two left feet or not, I just want you to forget all about your troubles and have fun." he said sincerely before a devious smile appeared on his face "Or maybe the big, bad Avatar is scared of a little dancing?"

Oh it is on.

"Bolin, shut up and dance with me." she commanded as she dragged him to the dance floor.

"Yes ma'am!" he said happy to have the old Korra back.

At first Korra was a very awkward dancer, she stepped on a few toes and bumped into some people, but with Bolin's encouragement she was able to find her rhythm and started to move in perfect sync with her partner. Their dancing wasn't anything fancy at first but as the night went on they seemed to be subconsciously teaching each other as with each new song that played they seamlessly change from an awkward but cute slow dance, to an upbeat tap dance, to graceful waltz, and finally to a passionate and intimate tango. Needless to say they were the most watched couple of the club.

But sadly all good things must come to an end sooner or later as the clock showed it was well pasted midnight and they both had long days ahead of them. So Bolin escorted Korra to the bay where she would swim back to Air Temple Island.

"You didn't have to do this Bo." she said with a tired but content voice.

"Oh but I do. As I said I'm an old fashioned guy so I must escort my fair lady home." he said with a legitimately suave voice.

She raised an amused eyebrow at him "'Your' fair lady?"

He back peddled realizing what he just said "Um I-I mean that is not to say I own you or anything! But you are a fair lady, more then fair in fact! You're gorgeous and fun and-" His tangent was cut short by Korra giving him a quick kiss on the cheek.

"I like the sound of that." she said with a cheeky wink before she jumped into the bay and swam with the grace and speed of a mermaid back home.

Bolin was left stunned as he touch the spot where Korra kiss. Then a huge, goofy grin spread across his face as hearts floated around his head "What a woman." he sigh dreamily as he headed back home.
1151312.title: Shut up and dance with me!

choices: To go for it! They start dating!
11513123.content:
Tenzin approached Korra's room cautiously as he knew that she was not a morning person on the best of days, 'the morning is evil' as she has frequently put it. And with her failures in trying to learn the basics of Airbending over the last few days she was no doubt going to be in a rather frustrated mood.

But he was proven wrong as just as he was about to knock on her door she opened it, freshly dressed and well rested judging from the content smile on her face. She stretched her arms over her head "*Yawn* Good morning Tenzin." she said pleasantly as she walked pasted him to the dinning room for breakfast.

Tenzin was somewhat stunned at this, but recovered quickly to follow after her "Good morning Korra. I trust you slept well?" he inquired politely.

"Very well. Best night sleep I've had in awhile." she answered honestly. Her gentle smile increasing slightly thinking about her both her date and dream from last night. Both of which involved her being in the arms of a certain upcoming Pro-Bending champion. Only in her dream things ended in a more..exciting way.

"Glad to hear it." Tenzin said happy for her before turning solemn "Now Korra I know the last couple of days haven't been as..productive as either of us would have liked." he said carefully "But I just want to take this time to remind you that Airbending isn't about brute strength and aggression, it's about using passive resistance in response to aggression. There is flow it, a rhythm if you will. You must surrender yourself to that rhythm and allow it to guide you through the gates."

Tenzin had tried to explain this to her many times already, but it has always gone completely over her head. But her experience last night made her pause to really think about his words. "A rhythm huh?" she said quietly to herself cupping her chin in deep thought.

"Korra?" asked Tenzin puzzled.

"Hey Tenzin, do you guys own a record player by any chance?" she asked with a brainstorm forming.

"We do, why?"

"I have an idea! I'll tell you all about it after breakfast!" she said while racing down the hall, eager to try out her idea.

Tenzin blinked rapidly at her curious behavior, but as he smelled his wife's delicious cooking he power walked to join her.

(1 hour later)

Korra stood before her old nemesis, The Spinning Gates, with a determined fire in her eye. She looked over to Jinora who had the record player ready and gave her a nod. The young Airbender placed the needle on the vinyl and a soothing orchestra filled the courtyard as Korra closed her eyes and let the melody flow through her. She slowly swayed over to the gates and with the grace of a ballerina she spun, twirled, cartwheeled and flipped through the gates without touching any of them once.

As the music faded out and the gates stopped spinning a slightly out of breath Korra was greeted with a standing ovation from Jinora, Ikki and Meelo while Tenzin was frozen in astonishment.

"That..that was incredible." Tenzin whispered in awe.

"Beautiful!" Jinora added with wonder.

"Amazing!" Ikki squealed with cheer.

"Wow!" Meelo exclaimed.

Korra blushed slightly at all the praise, but was very happy to finally be making some progress in her training. "Aw shucks guys, was it really that good?" she asked modestly.

"It was better then good!" Tenzin said just as happy at Korra's performance as his children. "Your training method was rather unorthodox, but creative thinking is heavy encouraged in Airbending. Tell me, how did you come up with the idea to use music to help you?"

Korra was unsure of how to answer that and was even tempted to lie, but she thought better of it and decided to just tell the truth. "Before I say anything Tenzin, I want you to promise wait until I'm done explaining and try your best not to be mad." she pleaded to her master.

Tenzin had a bad feeling about this, but his curiosity over her sudden leap in skill needed to be satisfied "Very well, I promise."

And so Korra told him about all that she did last night while make it very clear that nothing really big happened between her and Bolin. Needless to say Tenzin was not happy to hear that Korra disobeyed him in leaving the island, especially at night to go see a Pro-Bending match. And then she apparently went on a date with some boy named Bolin?! His fatherly instincts kicked into high gear upon hearing this.

Tenzin took in a deep breath "Korra..I am very disappointed that you disobeyed my wishes for you to stay on the island and I made it very clear on my thoughts on Pro-Bending." he said as calmly as he could.

"I know Tenzin, but-"

She was cut off by Tenzin raising a stern hand "I let you say your peace Korra. Now I will say mine." he said with his tone not changing. Korra was silent as he continued "I'll be honest, I was beginning to lose my patience with not just your lack of progress but also in your attitude. And ordinarily hearing this last stunt you pulled on top of all that would've been the last straw before I would lay down the law." he said with his tone getting progressively harder, causing Korra to tuck into herself meekly. "However," his tone then became warmer "it's clear to me now that perhaps I need to apply some creative to my own teaching methods. My father once told me that if a teacher is unable to learn with their student, then they are not meant to teach."

Korra blinked in surprise at this and a hopeful smile appeared on her face "So, does that mean I can see Bolin's match tonight? I promised him I would be there."

"You can, on the condition that you will take your training more seriously. And in return I will allow you more freedom, but within reason."

"Deal! In fact why don't you come see the match with me? I think you will actually like Pro-Bending if you give it a chance." she offered.

"Yeah daddy, can we all come too?! Can we?! Can we?!" Ikki asked bouncing up and down with excitement with Jinroa and Meelo joining in. Jinora wanted to meet Bolin while Meelo was joining just for fun.

Tenzin sighed resignedly "Very well." Korra and the children cheered as they joined together in a group hug. When the group hug ended Tenzin then went back into teaching mode "Now Korra, let's see if you make it through the gates without the music."

"Right!"

(Later that night)

When Tenzin agreed to take his family out to see a Pro-Bending match he did not expect it to be this nerve racking as apparently The Fire Ferret's Waterbender was a no show and Korra volunteered to step in for them, much to Mako reluctance. It was a rough match to say the least as while Korra was a very skilled bender she wasn't very familiar with the rules of Pro-Bending, her inexperience causing them to lose two rounds. She even Earthbended at one point during the match revealing herself as the Avatar. But she was able to continue as long she only bends water. And luckily for her all of her Airbending training from today was really kicking in as during the last round she became untouchable as The Platypus-Bears exhausted themselves firing at her, allowing Bolin and Mako to deal a Knockout, wining the match.

While he wasn't happy with it at first, Tenzin had to admit that Pro-Bending was a lot fun to watch. Especially when it gave him the opportunity to see his student put what he taught her to good use. And his family had a great time too, cheering Korra on.

And now at the fighter podium after celebrations had died down and Mako had stepped out to give them some privacy Bolin and Korra now found themselves trapped in an awkward silence.

"So..about last night.." Bolin started "I just want to make sure I'm not getting any mixed signals here. Are we a thing? Are we just friends? Or..?"

Korra thought long and hard about how to answer. She had never felt this way about anyone before and didn't want to screw it up. She knew Bolin was a sweet guy, strong, funny, dependable and handsome. Qualities any woman would want in a man, but she never dated before and didn't want to break his heart if they didn't work out. He didn't deserve that. So after giving it much thought she decided..
11513123.title: So, about last night..

choices: Forget about Amon and just focus on the love.
115131231.content:
"I'm up for giving us a shot if you are." she said hopefully.

Bolin beamed at hearing this news, not only was he finally getting a girlfriend, but said girlfriend was The Fricking Avatar! Sure Korra was rough around the edges, but he thought her rough edges were charming. Also she was not only a very pretty girl, but a very pretty girl that could kick ass and loved to have a good time. Needless to say, Bolin felt like he hit the jackpot.

"Absolutely!" he cheered as he scooped her up in a bear hug which she happily returned.

"Ahem." The new couple froze in place before turning behind them slowly to meet the Airbending family. Pema and the children all had varying degrees of amusement on their faces, while Tenzin was stone faced and his robes bellowed slightly from a breeze of his own making. "Are we interrupting something?" he asked rhetorically.

"Tenzin! Everyone, hey!" Korra exclaimed nervously. "Did you..enjoy the match hehe?"

"Korra, when we agreed to come to this match you said nothing about you participating in it."

"It wasn't planned I swear!" she hastefully explained "Their Waterbender was a no show and I couldn't just let them forfeit! They're my friends and Pro-Bending means more to them then you realize, I had to do something!"

"It appears to me that you are more then friends with this..Bolin was it?"

"Yep that's me! Bolin of The Fire Ferrets at your service, sir!" he announced nervously while standing at attention like a solider, even giving the Airbending master a salute for good measure.

"*Giggle* He seems like a nice young man." Pema said playfully.

"He's cute. I can see why you like him Korra." Jinora teased.

"He's funny looking!" Ikki giggled at his goofy posture.

Meelo was silent for a minute as he gave Bolin a once over. "Meh. She could do better." he shrugged.

As Korra was drowning in embarrassment over their comments on her new boyfriend, Bolin felt like a prison inmate on death row from the stare Tenzin was giving him. And as he slowly approached the young Earthbender, who was now sweating bullets, the podium went silent as everyone waited with baited breath on what Tenzin would do next.

"Since you have proven yourself to be a positive influence on Korra thus far, you have my blessing to pursue this relationship." he stated calmly, sending a wave of relief to everyone present that he also approved of Bolin. "But let me make one thing clear," his voice now feeling like the calm before a storm "If you hurt her in anyway, you will answer to me. Are we clear?"

"As crystal, sir!" Bolin squeaked out feeling like he was about to wet himself.

"Good." Tenzin said pleasantly, his ominous aura disappearing.

"Dear," Pema said gently wrapping her arms around her husbands shoulders to help relieve the rest of the tension in the room " why do we all go out for dinner tonight? It will give us all a chance to get to know Bolin properly and celebrate Korra taking her first steps in her Airbending training."

Tenzin hummed thoughtfully to himself while stroking his beard "An excellent idea." he agreed much to their children's delight, they have gone out as a family in a while. Pema sent a subtle wink to Bolin to let him know that he had her full support, much to his relief.

"Bolin, why do you show everyone the place you took me last night?" Korra suggested, excited in both everyone approval in their new relationship and getting to eat some of her favorite foods from home again.

"Good idea!" Bolin said happily "We should a remember to invite Mako too."

"Aww, do we have to?" Korra pouted.

"Yes we do. He's my brother and your new teammate, you're both gonna have to learn to get along." he said with a playfully stern tone.

"Okay." she pouted more with arms crossed.

He chuckled at her cuteness before he remembered something important "Oh, I should also introduce you to Pabu before we leave!"

"Who's Pabu?"

"My best friend and our teams mascot! You're gonna love him."

Sure enough Korra instantly fell in love with Bolin's Fire Ferret and Pabu quickly warmed up to her as well. And the rest of the night went by quickly but pleasantly as The Airbending Family bonded very well with The Pro-Bending Brothers. Sure Mako was a bit of a stick in mud at first, but even he was able to get over himself and have some fun. Before the new couple parted ways for the time being they shared sweet embrace and a quick but heartfelt first kiss. It was an adorable sight to all who saw it. And as the night went on said couple stared into the distance of the bay from their rooms, pondering what the future held for them before drifting off into a peaceful sleep.
115131231.title: Going all in!

1151312311.content:
This morning had started out so promising. Bolin was training with his brother and girlfriend in the gym, having some quality time together. But then the owner of the area, and their landlord, came in to give them their earnings for last nights match, only to immediately take it all back to pay for rent, Korra's new gear, gym rentals from last month and of course groceries. If that wasn't bad enough it turns out they needed to ante up 30000 yuans for the championship pot and if they didn't come up with the cash by the end of the week they were out of the tournament.

So with that in mind Bolin came up with the idea to have Pabu preform some of the circus tricks he had been teaching him, but neither Mako or Korra really had faith in that idea. But Mako reassured them that he would think of something, he always did. And Korra promised that she would do all she could to help, but she needed to head back home to resume her Airbending training, so after giving him a parting kiss on the cheek she raced back to Air Temple Island.

But despite what either of them have said Bolin went forward with his idea, confident that people would be blow away by Pabu's talents and reward said talents with lots of money. Only to have that confidence shattered as all he had to show for all his hours of work being one measly yuan coin in a cup.

"One yuan down, 29999 to go." he said while dejectedly staring at the coin. But just then a highly customized Satomobile drove up in front of him. The driver revealed himself to be a shady looking Water Tribe man appropriately named Shady Shen.

"Bolin, is that you?" the gangster asked casually.

"Oh, hey Shady Shen." Bolin responded halfheartedly.

"Heard your a big time Pro-Bender now, not bad." said the crooked man with slightly a condescending tone as he approached the young man.

"Thanks." Bolin said sarcastically quickly getting sick of talking to this guy. "Cut to the chase Shen, what do you want?"

"Oh ho! Look who's grown some backbone since we last met! " Shen said a little impressed "Alright so here's the deal, Lightning Bolt Zolt is looking for some extra muscle. And I thought that you would be up for it, you know for old times sake."

"Nuh uh. No way. I am done with The Triple Threats, go bother some other poor schmuck with your sales pitch cause I ain't buying." Bolin said while turning his nose up at Shen.

"Aw, but your the only poor schmuck we need for this job. It's just a little security work, nothing crooked." Shen obviously lied. But to sweeten the deal he reached into his outer jacket and pulled out a wad of cash that he tossed into Bolin's cup. Bolin was honestly surprised by the amount of money he was just given, it looked to be 10000 yuans easily. "You game?" he asked with a self-satisfied smirk, confident he sealed the deal.

Bolin was honestly tempted to accept, but he knew that he would never forgive himself if he allowed himself to break his word to cut all ties with The Triple Threats. And that's nothing to say about what would happen if Mako and Korra found out if he did accept, he refused to disappoint either of them.

He picked up the wad of bills and tossed them back at Shen who caught it with stunned look on his face. "My answer is still no." he said steadfastly. "Come on Pabu." He picked all his stuff and began to walk away with his furry friend in tow, but the shady man still had an ace up his sleeve.

"Well look at little Bolin all grown up." he said with faux pride as he pulled out a small photo from his pocket "Has it really been 2 years since we last saw each other? My how time flies.." he trailed off as if he was actually reliving fond memories.

Curious as to what he was talking about Bolin turned his head to get a better look at the photo, only to feel a wave of horror wash over him. It was a picture of him and Mako sharing a small cake from his 14th birthday, with Lightning Bolt Zolt in the background with what looked like a proud smile on his face.

"Everyone knows that The Fire Ferrets used to be street urchins, little kids who came from nothing. But through hard work and grit were able to make something of themselves. A truly heartwarming underdog story, but we both know that's only half the story. Right Bo?" Shen said with that damn smirk. And he was right, neither he or Mako told any Pro-Bending officials about their time with The Triple Threats because no self respecting sports business would want to be associated with anyone who had ties to such a well know and powerful crime boss.

Bolin clenched his hand into fist so tight his knuckles cracked and he was about to bury the smug prick, but Shen just raised his hand in a stopping motion.

"Uh uh uh. We don't want to be making a scene now do we?" he asked rhetorically while gesturing to the people around them, some of who were watching the scene curiously. "Now you have two choices Bolin, you can either stick to your guns and walk away. Which might be the right thing to do, but also the dumb thing as I would have no choice but to do the right thing as well and let the Pro-Bending big shots know that they have a Triple Threat in their ranks." he said while tauntingly waving the picture. "Or you can do the smart thing and take the job. And as long as you play ball with us, this little photo and all the others we have of you and Mako, will never see the light of day. So champ, what's it gonna be?"

Shen had him by the balls, because their entire future was at stake. With how popular Pro-Bending was word would get out fast about this whole scandal. And after they were kicked out to save face every other business would want nothing to do with them in order to protect their own reputations. And that's nothing to say of what will happen to Korra's reputation if it got out that she was dating a criminal. He was given two choices, but he knew he only had one.

"*Sigh* Fine." Bolin said resignedly.

"I knew you would come around." Shen said smugly as he turned back to get in his car.

With Shen's back turned Bolin took the opportunity to give Pabu some instructions "Pabu, go find Mako!" he whispered quickly. The ferret understanding the order scurried off to do just that.

As Bolin joined Shen in the car, a question came to him that he just had to have answered. "Shen, why does Zolt really need extra muscle? And why me specifically?"

A slim, curvy, but tall and imposing hooded figure with a porcelain mask with a full red moon on the forehead. She walked down the row of kneeling gangters before her until she came to Bolin at the end. He was so full of terror that it felt as if Koh The Face Stealer was right in front of him, looking to add to his collection.

And his terror only increased when she crouched down to get a better look at him. Those shadowed eyes felt like they were looking into his very soul, judging him for his final destination. She reached out a hand and Bolin saw his life flash before his eyes, he then closed them shut, waiting for the end, hoping it was quick and painless.

Only to feel his cloth gag be removed with surprising gentleness.

"Why are you here?" asked a deep, but very feminine voice.

Bolin opened his eyes to see Amon holding the gag and staring at him with what seemed to be simple curiosity.

"Uhhh.." was all he could responded with, too amazed with the fact that he was still alive.

"Ma'am." A mustached Equalist spoke up "We found him in the Triple Threat headquarters and-"

"I was speaking to him lieutenant." Amon cut him off calmly. "I want him, to answer."

Bolin realized that maybe he had a chance to get out of the mess, so he took in a deep breath an explained as calmly as he could.

"I'm not with The Triple Threats by choice! They had dirt on me and my brother, if I didn't work with them Shady Shen was going to destroy our chances at making an honest living! I mean sure we did some work for them back in the day, but it wasn't anything too bad I swear! I helped load cargo and Mako ran numbers, that's all! Well okay we also helped with clean up after deals didn't end well, but that's really it, I promise! We were kids off the street, our parents were killed when we little and we had nowhere else to turn and..and..*sob*"

Bolin was sure that it didn't matter what he said, with no proof their is no way the would ever believe him. And he doubted that the water works would sway them, even though the tears were genuine. One way or another, his life was over.

Or at least that's what he thought before he felt Amon gently cup his to raise his face and look her in the eye. He could faintly make out what seem to be light blue eyes full of empathy and he felt his tears being softly wiped away with her thumb.

She then stood up and back the row of captives until she found Shady Shen. She the search his person until she found the photo that had Bolin on a leach.

"He is telling the truth. Let him go." she ordered.

"But ma'am he's-"

"An innocent strong armed into a gang war he wanted nothing to do with by scum he left behind in pursuit of an honest life." she finished for him.

She then walked toward her lieutenant to make sure he heard her clearly. "Need I remind you lieutenant that my mission, your mission, our mission, is to bring justice and equality to all. Bender and Non-Bender alike. You would do well to remember that. Am I understood?"

The lieutenant folded before his leaders gaze and bowed in remorse "Perfectly ma'am, forgive me."

"You are forgiven, but do not make me remind you again." she calmly warned as she walked back to Bolin.

As she helped him to his feet and freed him from his bounds she said "You are an honest soul Bolin. And from what I've seen in The Pro-Bending arena a skilled and honorable fighter. I am honestly a bit a fan of yours."

"Really?" he asked in astonishment as he rubbed his now freed writs.

"Despite what rumors may say, I am human and I have a life outside of my work." she said with a slightly cheeky tone.

Bolin chucked a little at how surreal this all was, he never would have imagined that Amon had a sense of humor.

"Now, I'm sure your brother is worried about you and you are eager to get home, but I must warn you that the streets are dangerous at this time of night, especially at this part of the city." she informed the young man "But I will not force you to stay if you wish to leave. So, do you wish to leave or would like to come with me to my quarters to rest for the night? I give you my word that I will escort you home first thing in the morning."

Bolin was really taken aback by her generous offer, but he had to admit, taking sometime to get to know the mysterious Amon a little was very tempting. But he also knew that Mako and Korra were no doubt worried sick about him. So after a minute of thinking it over he decide to..

"I appreciate the offer, but I think it would be best if I take my leave." Bolin said politely, doing his best not offend her.

"Are you certain?" Amon asked calmly. "This city can be like a maze at night, even to those who have lived here all their lives."

"Yeah, I'm sure. And don't worry I know this town like the back of my hand." he stated confidently. "Besides, I'm a big boy, I can take care of myself." he said while flexing his muscles to prove his point.

Amon let out a small chuckle of amusement "Clearly. But before you go I would like you to have this." she said while handing him a piece of paper that had a portrait of Amon reaching out with her hand as if it had the answer to an age old question with the words 'Witness The Revelation tonight at 9:00.' on it.

"What's this revelation?" he asked curiously.

"You have no doubt heard rumors and misconceptions of my goals for this city. I plan to set the record straight tomorrow night. And you are welcome to attend, along with anyone else you would like to bring with you." she explained "Which reminds me.." she turned her attention back to the criminals kneeling on the floor "Get the rest of this filth ready for tomorrow." she ordered her troops who carried out her order quick and efficient.

Bolin turned the paper over to see if it had instructions on how to find where this event was taking place, but all he could see was a red dot in the upper left hand corner. "But there is no map on this thing, how will I find out where is if I do want to come?" he asked very confused.

She turned back to face him "You're a big boy, I'm sure you can figure it out." she teased. Even though he couldn't see it because of the mask Bolin was sure that she had a shit-eating smirk on her face. "Until we meet again." she said with a parting bow as she vanished into the darkness from wince she came.

Bolin stood alone in the warehouse room for minute to really process all that just happen. "Man she is awesome." he said to himself softly. "Scary beyond all reason, but awesome." With that said he then walked to the exit confident that he would find his way home in no time.

(The next morning)

"I think I passed that shop 3 times already." a hopelessly lost Bolin said to himself. "Aw man, my feet are killing me." he complained as he sat down to rest for a minute. After catching his breath he noticed a tram waiting booth across the street, they always had maps that told your current location. So he picked himself up to get a sense on where to go from here, only to meet two familiar faces. "Korra?! Mako?!" he exclaimed unable to believe his luck.

"Bolin/Bolin!!" they shouted with relief as they ran to embrace him in a group hug, which he welcomed wholeheartedly. "We were so worried!" Korra said with moist eyes as she peppered his face with kisses.

"How did you manage to escape?" Mako asked.

"Well that's the thing, I didn't. Amon just let me go." he explained.

"What/What?!" they asked greatly confused as the broke the hug.

"It's true! Once Amon found out I wasn't really with The Triple Threats she set me free. Even gave me this." he said while showing them his invitation.

"We just pieced together where this revelation taking place too." Korra said.

"Really? Because I can't make heads or tails of it."

"It's part of a puzzle bro." Mako said as he put all the pieces together for him to see.

"Ooooh. That makes sense."

"Okay, now all that's left to do is find this Amon and teach her a lesson." Korra said as she cracked her knuckles.

"Actually Amon isn't as bad as you think she is, I mean she did let me go." Bolin reminded.

"Sure, after her lackeys kidnapped you." Korra countered.

"Actually, we don't have to do anything else. Bolin's safe, so lets just call it a day." Mako reasoned.

"Well I think we should go. I'm sure if you guys give her a chance you'll see that Amon's better then you think." Bolin reaffirmed.

"We'll see about that." Korra challenged.

Mako gave them a deadpan stare "You two are perfect for each other, you're both crazy."

(Later that night)

Bolin, Korra and Mako now found themselves in a crowd of thousands of people from all walks of life in what seemed to be an abandoned factory. There was a stage set up and the people were anxiously waiting for the event to start. Then the stage was lit and an announcer spoke "PLEASE WELCOME YOUR HERO, YOUR SAVIOR, AMON!!!"

The crowd cheered as from under the stage floors rose Amon with 6 of her finest men behind her. Amon waited for the cheers to die down before she addressed her audience.

"Ever since I was little I believed that everyone had the right to be treated fairly, equally. Only to learn quickly that few shared my beliefs. Our world is not a fair place my friends, this is the reality that we face everyday. Poverty, starvation, disease, discrimination, war. These are horrors that have plagued humanity since the beginning of time. It often makes one wonder, what's the point of it all?"

Her speech had the audience hooked as they could feel the genuine emotion from her voice that made up for not being able to see her face.

"That is a question I have asked myself many times before. And every time I do I remember my favorite story. It is the story of a man who lost everything and to top it off was burdened with the task of bringing peace and balance to a world ravaged by a century of war. A man who faced the absolute worst humanity had to offer when he was just a boy. A man who was told that if he was to save the world, a world that has already taken so much from, he must sacrifice his beliefs, that all life is precious and worth protecting."

Everyone knew this story, it was the story of Avatar Aang.

"And in spite of it all he managed to do the impossible, he saved the world while also staying true to his beliefs. And with the friends and allies he made on his journey, he founded The United Republic Of Nations. A place for people from all over the world can come together to share their cultures, learn and explore new ideas, to live a life full of endless possibilities. I ask you, how can one not be inspired by such a story?"

There were whispers in the crowd, ranging from people agreeing with her sentiments, people grumbling about how she could actually side with benders, to others who were just wondering where she was going with all this.

"I'm sure many of you are may not agree with me, I am aware that many of you were hoping I was the leader an Anti-Bending Revolution. But the truth is, I share the beliefs of Avatar Aang, that in spite of all the ugliness, all the darkness, all the evil that plagues our world that there is also beauty, light and good in this world. And it's worth fighting for. And I also believe that we all own great debt to Aang and all the Avatars before him. For too long have the people of the world forgotten that we too have the power to make a difference. For too long have we looked to The Avatar to protect our world for us. The time has come for us to repay our debt and come together to forge a better future for everyone!"

Bolin was in awe at Amon's passionte speech, he could she truely believed in what she said. The power of her charisma was even starting to make her neigh sayers come around.

"I understand that such a feat sounds daunting, but I am here to tell you that it is very possible. You maybe wondering, what is the revelation? You are about to get your answer. I am aware that many of the worst criminals in this city are powerful benders, scum who abuse their gifts to exploit the weak and take for their own gain. I have battled against this filth for years, I have studied bending in all it's forms and after countless hours of training and study I have created the ultimate chi-blocking technique. It is an ablitiy believed only to The Avatar, a power that was used to save the world from Ozai. The power to take someones Bending away. Permanently."

Everyone in the crowd was in shock at hearing this, Korra was especially sure that such a thing was impossible. But the proof was in the pudding as to demonstrate her skill Lightning Bolt Zolt was brought to the stage and was allowed to fight for the right to keep his bending. And despite giving it his all, even when firing his trademark lightning bolt at near point blank range Amon gracfully dodged all his attacks and closed the distance between the with incredible speed. She then brought him to his knees and placed a thumb on his forehead and crowd watched with awe as the lightning changed to fire and then the fire was snuffed out.

With the proof of her power laid bare Amon turned back to the audiunce. "Behold the revelation! That through hard work and being steadfast in your beliefs, anything is possible! Now I beseech thee, my freinds, join me! And together we will create a new era peace and balance! I can not win this fight alone, so help me! Take charge of your own future! FOR JUSTICE!! FOR EQUALITY!!" she finished by raising an emporing fist.

The crowd cheerd so loudly it could be heard all over the city. Bolin had to admit, he was pretty enamored by Amon's sheer chraisma himself. And as he looked to his friends he saw that Mako was in a similar state. But with Korra on the other hand, her eyes were filled not with admiration, but fear.

From the corner of his eye he noticed a bakery and a flower cart, which gave him the idea to buy a little something for her while he was at it. When he saw a break in traffic he ran across the street towards the bakery, only to be blindsided by a young woman on her moped.

"I am so sorry! I didn't see you!" she said with a sweet voice full of concern.

"Ah don't worry about it." Bolin said with a slightly bruised pride, but otherwise fine. "No harm dooo..." he trailed of as he got a proper look at her, only to be bewitched by her beauty.

Long wavy raven hair, flawless porcelain skin, plump lips with the perfect amount of lipstick, soft green eyes accentuated by light purple eye shadow and of course an hourglass figure.

"Do..duh..who..where..words..can't.." he was reduced to gibberish. Maybe he was hit harder then he thought.

"Are you okay? Did I hurt you? Agh, I'm such an idiot!" she chastised herself as she helped him to his feet.

"No, really I'm fine." Bolin reassured as his speaking skills returned. "I been hit by worse everyday in practice." he said as he dusted himself off.

The young woman's lit up as she got a better look at him "Hey I recognize you. Your Bolin right?! You play for The Fire Ferrets!" she said fangirling a little.

"Yep! That me!" he said with pride as he placed his fists on his hips and puffed up his chest like a superhero.

She lightly smacked herself, feeling like a complete fool in front of her favorite Pro-Bender. "I am so embarrassed." she said with a cute blush. "My name is Asami." she introduce herself with a handshake, which Bolin shook. "Let me make this up to you somehow. Umm..how about I treat you to dinner? Tomorrow night, 8:00, Kwong's Cuisine." she invited generously as she walked back to her moped.

"Kwong's?!" he asked incredulously. That was the most upscale restaurant in the city! He would need winnings from half of his matches this seasons just to afford a nice enough suit to get in! "Don't have any clothes nice enough for a place that classy!"

"I'll take care of that. All you need to do is show up." she said as she put on her helmet. "So..it's a date?" she asked hopefully.

"Uuuh yeah sure." was all he could say to such a generous offer from such a beautiful girl "I'll see you then."

As she drove off she gave him one last smile that sent his heart a flutter, only to feel a wave of horror was over him as he realized what he just did. "OH CRAP!! WHAT HAVE I DONE!!" he shouted with his eyes nearly popping out of his skull.

"Oh I'll tell you what you did Bolin, you broke the number 1 rule of dating!" he chastised himself "Never ask another girl out when your already in a relationship!"

"Well technically she asked me out." he weakly pointed out.

"That doesn't make it better!" he countered harshly.

Done arguing with himself he took in a deep breath to calm down "It's okay. I can fix this. First thing I need to do is tell Korra the truth. And make it clear that you committed to her and you will let Asami know about your relationship with Korra when you see her tomorrow night." he said firmly to himself. He then gave himself a nod, confident in his plan. Only to feel the wave of doom wash over him again "That's if Korra doesn't feed me to Naga first." he said with comical tears flowing down his face.

[And she's so nice!] he cried to himself inside [Oh this nights going to be torture!] Luckily he was able to successfully mask his inner turmoil with a grateful smile. "Thanks. So I take it your quite the Pro-bending fan huh?"

"A huge fan. I caught all your matches this season. My favorite was the one with the Tiger-Dillo's at the end when it was just you against three, they way you bravely tanked all to hits without budging! It was like you were made of steel!" she said with increasing excitement, before regaining her composure "Sorry, it just gets me pumped up whenever I think about it. I can't wait to see you in the tournament." she said with a cute blush.

"Sorry, maybe next year." he a little down at remembering his teams financial problems.

"What do you mean?" she asked puzzled "You made it in."

"We did but..It turns out that we need to ante up 30000 yuans for the championship pot and we don't the cash so..we're out of the running." he explained depressingly.

"That's not fair." she said truly sad for him.

"Hey don't worry about it." he said returning to good spirits "I'm honestly amazed we made it as far as we did, so I'm of proud me and my team. But enough about me, I'd like to get to know you more. Though from the way you got so excited about taking about my match with The Tiger-Dillo's it sounds to me your a bit of an adrenaline junkie." he teased with a raised eyebrow.

Asami blushed again and twirled a strand of her hair shyly "Well..I do test new Satomobile models on the race track at home so you might be on to something." she admitted.

"Race track? So you're a racer?"

"Not exactly."

"Pardon me Miss Sato, you main course." said a waiter placing two silver platters on the table. He opened the lids to reveal some sort of fancy, but tiny shrimp dish.

"You sure this is the main course?" Bolin said while curiously pointing at the meager meal "It looks more like an appetizer."

His innocent question combined with the waiters very unamused face as he walked off made Asami burst with laughter.

"Was it something I said?" Bolin asked confused, which only made Asami laugh harder. He wasn't really sure what was so funny, but he had to admit she had a lovely laugh. [Is there anything about this woman that isn't cute?] he wondered to himself, before her last name registered with him. "Wait a minute, Sato?! As in Hiroshi Sato inventor of the Satomobile?!" he asked astonished.

"Yep, he's my dad." she said casually as she recovered from her laughing fit.

"Get out.."

"I'm serious. You want to meet him?" she asked while taking a sip of her tea.

"Meet arguably the richest man in the city if not the world?! Twist my arm!" he said while digging into his meal, finishing it in five seconds. "Oh man this is good." he said with a slightly full mouth.

His rather poor table manners made quite a scene for the other patrons who thought he was some uncouth simpleton, but Asami found it refreshing since she was so used to people trying to impress her all the time. To see him be himself even when he found out who she was made her feel relaxed as he was treating her like a normal person instead of royalty which she got enough of as is.

"Oh do you mind if I bring one of my girlfriend with me to meet your dad?" Bolin asked thinking the was the perfect opportunity to bring it up.

"Girlfriend?" she asked a little shocked.

"Yeah Korra, my Waterbending teammate. You would mind would you?" he asked wondering if maybe he made a mistake in telling her like this.

"No, not at all. The more the merrier." she said with a forced smile as she turned to her meal.

Yeah he screwed up alright.

"I wasn't really sure how to bring it up." he admitted awkwardly "I didn't mean-"

"No no it's fine really." Asami reassured him. "I should have figured a guy as sweet as you would be off the market anyway, all the best ones are." she said a little down at her missed opportunity.

Now Bolin was the kind of guy who couldn't stand to see a woman in distress, especially if was the cause of said distress. So he knew there was only one thing to do at a time like this..

115131231122211124.content:
"Come on. Let's get out of here." Bolin stated boldly as he stood up.

"What?" Asami asked confused.

"I'm going to be honest, this place is fancy and the food is delicious, but it's not fun. I really appreciate you going through as this trouble for a poor schmuck like me, but now it's my turn to repay you for your kindness. So I propose we start this date over and go for a night on the town." he said while reaching out a hand for her to take.

This whole change in tone really threw Asami for a loop, but she had to admit that while she was used to dinning in places like Kwong's she did not like the near impossible standards places like this had for customers just to get in. All the favors she called in and strings she pulled just to have Bolin be able to enter was ridiculous. Definitely not the most welcoming place. Though she did often wonder what it would be like just to go on a simple date without all the extravagance.

"Well, I guess we could try. But what about your girlfriend won't she-"

"You let me worry about that. For right now the only woman in my life is you. And I want to make this a night you will never forget." he said with a charming smile. But then he realized how what he just said could mean something totally different then what he meant "In a good way of course." he added sheepishly.

His goofy charms made her giggle and was enough to convince her "Okay, let's go." she said as she quickly paid for their meal and took his offered hand.

As they walked outside Asami escorted Bolin to a custom made Satomobile with her butler waiting for them. The butler being a tall, intimidating but beautiful Water Tribe woman. Her dark hair reached just past her shoulders and the only blemish on her otherwise perfect skin was a small third degree burn scar on her right cheek.

"Finished already Miss Sato?" the driver inquired professionally.

"Noa, how many times do I have to tell you to call me Asami when dad's not around?" Asami asked like they have had this conversation a million times.

"Possibly more then you already have." Noa answered with a small grin.

Asami pouted a little but she knew it was all in good fun. "Bolin, I would like you to meet Noataka. She's been a part of my family ever since I was little."

"A pleasure." she said neutrally with a small bow and offering her hand for a handshake.

"Nice to meet you." Bolin said friendly as he accepted the gesture.

The butler's grip was as strong and cold as iron. This was a tactic that she used to really test the character of people who associate with Asami. If they buckled under her strength or commented on how cold her hand was it meant they were weak and not just physically.

"Nice grip you got there." Bolin said impressed as he squeezed his hand to match her strength.

"Likewise." she said impressed herself at Bolin not only not buckling under the pressure, but meeting the challenge with his own. "I like this one." she said with a slight flirty tone.

"Noa!" Asami exclaimed with a blush.

Noataka let out a small chuckle as she released the handshake and open the car door for the young couple. Once they were all buckled in Noa asked "Where to ma'am?"

"I don't know, where do you think Bolin?" Asami asked.

Bolin pondered the question for a minute until he found his answer. "Let's go to get something real to eat. Don't get me wrong, Kwong's was the best food I ever tasted, but it wasn't what I'd really call a meal, you know? And this time, it's my treat."

"Sounds good." Asami agreed.

And so Bolin gave instructions to his favorite food joint and when they got there Bolin offered Noataka to join them. She was going to refuse at first but she had to admit it had been years since she had an authentic plate of Water Tribe food. The scent of some of her own favorite foods coming from the eatery brought up many fond and bittersweet memories of home. So she figured, what the hell, and joined them at the table.

The food was not as fancy as Kwong's, but it was still very good, and filling. And best of all the atmosphere was much more welcoming and friendly. The small talk at the table was comfortable and full of laughs as Bolin regaled the ladies with tales of some of the funniest moments he and his brother had while training in the gym. Like how one time Mako accidentally hit Bolin with a head shot and set his hair on fire. Or the time when Papu peed on Mako's uniform and he spent the whole afternoon chasing after the ferret, threatening to make to make him into a hat, only for the ferret to constantly outwit him in increasingly embarrassing ways for Mako.

With their bellies full the trio returned to the car, this time it was Asami's turn to decide on where to go next and she decided on..

1151312311222111241.content:
"Take us to the park Noa. There's something I want to show Bolin." said Asami with a fond smile.

Noataka immediately understood what her young mistress was talking about as fond smile of her own appeared on her face "Of course ma'am."

A short drive later and the trio arrived at Republic City Park. As Asami guided Bolin through the path she wrapped her arms around one of his muscular arms and rested her head on his broad shoulder. Bolin was a little surprised at this intimate action, but he welcomed it by tenderly brushing some of her silky hair over her ear [She smells like Jasmine.] he thought pleasantly to himself.

"So, what is it that you want to show me? Or is it some sort of surprise?" he asked excitedly.

"That." she said while pointing to a tree. There didn't really seemed to be anything special about this tree that set it apart from all the others in the park, so Bolin was a little confused as to what the big deal was. "This is were I first met Noataka." Asami clarified.

"Ooh I see. So there's a story there huh?"

"Mm-hm, I was 5 at the time. My parents were taking me on a carriage ride through the park. Then I saw an ice cream cart, so naturally I begged my parents to go get some and they both left the carriage to get enough for all of us. As soon as they left a gust of wind blew my favorite sunhat away, so I got out of the carriage to chase after it. I don't know how long I had been chasing it but, by the time I finally caught it I realized I had no idea where I was."

"That must have been terrifying." Bolin said full of empathy. He remembered all the times when he got separated from Mako on the streets, it was not fun.

"It was. My parents taught me that if I was ever lost, I should find a safe place to hide and stay put until they could find me. So that's what I did, I hunkered down on the base of that tree and waited. I waited for hours, it was getting dark, cold and was even starting to rain and I was so sacred. But then I heard a voice say-"

"Are you alright little lady?" Noataka finished for her as she seemed to appear out of nowhere, causing Bolin and Asami to jump out of their skin a little.

"Must you do that Noa?" Asami asked slightly irritated while placing a hand on her racing heart.

"No, but it's fun." the cheeky butler said with a small smirk. Her face turned soft as fond memories flooded her mind "I remember clearly finding a scared little girl then putting on the bravest face she could and saying to me 'My parents told me never to talk to strangers, especially if I'm lost'. And I said to her 'Your parents taught you well. But a little lady like you shouldn't be left alone in the rain, so I'll keep you dry and safe until your parents find you.'"

Asami had a soft smile of her own as she continued "And that is what she did. Noa used her Waterbending to not only keep me dry, but used it to entertain me while we waited. She would make the water dance and take so many shapes it was like I had a front row seat at a circus!"

"Well I did used to work in a circus." Noataka pointed out.

"Seriously?" Bolin asked in slight disbelief.

"Yep. 'Ty Lee's Traveling circus.' I worked for her from my late teens to my early twenties. I learned many things from Ringmaster Ty Lee." Noataka said with a far away look as she recalled her rather whimsical years in the circus.

"Wait..Ty Lee?" Bolin asked as the name registered in his head "As in the same Ty Lee that worked for Azula before she rebelled and joined The Kyoshi Warriors?"

"The very same."

"Wow, that's awesome. What was she like?" he asked curiously.

Noataka paused for a minute to think on how to best describe her former boss "Pink. Very very pink."

From what Bolin had heard in stories that seemed about right.

"Before long I heard my parents calling out for me and Noa rushed off to guide them to me. When my parents asked her how they could repay her Noa insisted the didn't have to, but my mother would hear none of it. So she convinced my dad to hire her to be my personal attendant and made sure Noa had no choice but to accept her new job." Asami said with a cheeky tone.

Noataka had a sweat drop on the back of her head "Yeah, Lady Yasuko could not be swayed when she made up her mind about something."

"Why was she so insistent on you working for them?" Bolin asked the attendant curiously.

Noataka actually looked a little embarrassed as she explained "Well..that was because at the time I was homeless. I had left the circus about a year ago at the time to try and see if I could make a new life for myself here in Republic City. Unfortunately I was woefully unprepared for city life as I had only lived in The North Pole for most of my life and the circus was like it's own little world, so for a time I was force to live as a vagabond."

"So Asami's mom basically had to force you to not be homeless anymore?" Bolin asked with amusement.

"More or less." Asami answered for him with an amused smile of her own. But then her smile turned sad "Mom really was the best." she said softly.

"Indeed." Noataka agreed solemnly.

Bolin read the mood and recognized the pain in their eyes "I see. I lost my parents when I was very young too. In fact it happened so long ago..I can't even remember what they looked like." he said with tears falling down his face.

"That's terrible." Asami said with empathetic tears in her own eyes as she wrapped her arms around him in a tight embrace which he returned. Noataka looked on at the touching scene before her with with a smile smile, happy that her mistress could find someone other then herself to find comfort in.

Not long after Noataka had dropped Bolin off at the stadium, but not before Asami gave him a parting kiss on the cheek and said "See you tomorrow." with a warm smile as they drove off. Needless to say Bolin was equally looking forward to and dreading the next day.

(The next morning)

Bolin walking with a dance in his step and a Papu on his shoulder as he approached his girlfriend who was too busy playing with Naga to notice him just yet. "Hey there gorgeous." Bolin called out happily.

"Bolin!" Korra shouted with glee as she all but leaped into his arms and kissed him. As she broke the kiss Papu scurried off to go play with Naga "So, how was last night?" she asked curiously.

"Great! It got a little awkward when I told Asami about the fact I was already with you, but we still managed to have a good time." Bolin answered honestly.

"Well that's good to here." she said happy that things went so smoothly.

"Oh, and Asami invited you to come with me to meet her dad, who is Hiroshi Sato by the way!" Bolin said ecstatically.

"Really?!" Korra asked astonished.

"Really!"

She wasn't so sure about meeting this Asami girl, but she did trust and love her boyfriend enough to at least give it a shot "Well alright then."

"Trust me Korra, you're going to love Asami!" he said optimistically. But on the inside he was freaking out and praying that the meeting well go well.

11513123112221112413.content:
Bolin and Korra were in awe as Noataka escorted them through The Future Industries Main Factory, all the workers assembling Satomobiles in the hundreds at once truly was a sight to behold. Then they came across the head honcho himself Hiroshi Sato and his daughter waiting for them.

"Ah, you must be Bolin! Asami has told me much about you." Hiroshi greeted him with a friendly handshake "And you must be Avatar Korra, it's an honor to meet you." he said with slight reverence as he shook her hand.

"Likewise." Korra said politely. She then turned her attention to the person she really came to see, and came to the conclusion that Bolin's descriptions of her really didn't do Asami justice. She could see why her boyfriend was so enamored with her, even if she didn't want to admit it out loud. "You must be Asami." she said with a slightly forced polite tone.

"Nice to meet you." Asami said kindly, but even she had a slight edge in her voice.

[Okay, so far so good. Just got to keep things friendly and hopefully everyone can walk away from this happy.] Bolin thought to himself a little panicked.

"So, what do you think of my little operation here." Hiroshi asked snapping Bolin back to reality.

"Um.." he paused to look around to think of the best way to put it. "It's very impressive, Mr. Sato."

"Please call me Hiroshi. So, I understand you're dirt poor." the industrialist said rather bluntly.

"Well..yeah." Bolin said a little embarrassed as there was really no other way to put it.

"Young man, it's nothing to be ashamed of." the upper class man said kindly. "I too came from humble beginnings."

"Oh here we go." Noataka rolled her eyes at having to hear this story for the millionth time. As she did her best to tune out Hiroshi telling Bolin about how he started his industrial empire, she noticed how Korra and Asami never took their eyes off each other. The looks they were giving one another weren't hostile or friendly. But they were definitely judgmental as if they were trying to decide on whether or not the other was worthy of something. Or to be more accurate someone.

But then she heard that her boss was done with his story, so she thought it would be best to get things moving again. "Wonderful story as always sir. But how about you tell him what he really wants to hear." she said professionally, to which Hiroshi chuckled a bit.

"What do you mean?" Bolin asked.

"Well my daughter passionately told me all about your hard earned success in The Pro-Bending arena. And about your teams current..financial stumbling block." he said as he placed a comforting hand on Bolin's shoulder.

His words caused Korra to break her staring contest with Asami and turn her attention towards them, with Asami doing the same.

"Now my own rages to riches experience has made me quite the fan of underdog success stories. Which is why I'm going to sponsor The Fire Ferret's in the tournament!" he announced.

"For real?!" Bolin asked astonished.

"For real!" Asami cheerfully confirmed "He's going to cover your ante for the championship pot!"

"That's terrific!" Korra exclaimed gleefully.

"We're back in business baby!" Bolin cheered as he scooped Korra into his arms and spun her around in celebration much to her delight.

"There is one catch." Hiroshi cut in to the celebrations "You all have to wear The Future Industries logo on your uniforms."

"I'll tattoo it on my chest if you asked sir!" Bolin stated while pointing to his chest for emphasis.

"I'll have one for my back please!" Korra joined in.

"Careful now, he might just tell you to do that. And then you will be his property forever." Noataka warning playfully.

"Noa!" Asami shouted while lightly smacking her on the arm.

"Hmm..Owning The Avatar. Now that is a tempting idea." Hiroshi stroked his chin, seeming to give the idea some thought.

"Dad!" Asami gave him a light punch in the gut, knocking the wind out of him and causing everyone to burst into laughter.

"Thank you so much!" Bolin said as he gave Hiroshi another strong handshake "I promise that The Fire Ferret's will repay your kindness by winning the championship with style!"

"I'm sure you will young man."

"Hey dad, would you mind if I take them to the track?" Asami asked hopefully.

"Of course not."

"The track?" Korra asked curiously.

"I think it's time for you to see the best part of in making the Satomobile." Asami said eagerly.

(Later)

The roar of Satomobile engines echoed across the paved field as Bolin, Korra, Asami and Noataka sat in the bleachers of The Furture Industries Race Track watching two drivers testing out new models in a race.

"Pretty cool, right?" Asami asked her new friends.

"Way cool." Korra said in awe at the machines speeding down the pavement.

"I didn't know anything could move that fast!" Bolin said very impressed.

"Have either of you been behind the wheel?" Asami asked.

"I've been driven places, but never learned to drive myself." Bolin admitted.

"And the only thing I know how to drive is a polar bear dog." Korra said with a shrug.

"Want to go for a spin? Noa and I have been needing to have a tie breaker anyway." Asami said giving her attendant a challenging smirk, who responded in kind.

The couple looked at each other for a second before giving a nod in unison "Let's do it!/Let's do it!"

Bolin and Korra now found themselves buckled in the back seats with Noataka and Asami respectively. The rumble of the engines sent shivers of excitement through their bodies as they wait for the flag man to begin the race. Two waves of a flag later and they were off with Noataka quickly taking the lead and almost causing Asami to drift off the track, but she managed to right herself and stepped on it. She soon caught up to Noataka, but her attendant was not going to make it easy as she swerved from side to side to keep her from passing. But Asami wasn't so easily descouraged as she switched gears and floored it just in time to make a successful pass and gain the lead. Only for Noataka to switch gears herself to match her mistress's speed and soon they were neck and neck as they passed the finish line.

The drivers parked in the pit stop and a camerman came running up with a photo he took of the finish line to show that Asami had managed to win by just a hair.

"Yes!" she cheered as she and Korra shared a high five.

"Man! And I thought Pro-Bending was intense! We were going so fast I thought we were going to fly off the road a few times there!" Bolin said while leaning against the car trying to slow his pounding heart.

"I got to admit, I had you pegged wrong." Korras said to Asami humbly. "I thought you would be kind of prissy and spoiled. No offence."

"It's fine." Asami shrugged "I'm used to people asuming I'm daddies little rich girl, but I like to think I can handle myself. Dad's taught me about engineering since I could speak and Noataka has been teaching me self-defence since I was 6. That way if I was to one day take over the family business I would be ready for whatever life threw at me."

Korra smiled as she seemed to really look at Asami for the first time. Not as a threat or rival, but as a person. As a friend. "You know what Asami? I think you and I are going to get along just fine." she said as she extended a hand in friendship.

"I agree." Asami smiled as she accepted the hand.

Bolin pumped his fist in triumph as things today worked out better then he could have hoped.
