115131231122211124132.content:
Asami then spent the next few hours teaching Korra how to drive. It was pretty rocky at first cause for the first hour it seemed that Korra couldn't tell the difference between the gas or the brake, so she couldn't go more then 10 feet without suddenly stopping. And by the time she could tell the difference she nearly crashed into a wall. Luckily she was able to stop in time. But despite the nerve wrecking experience Asami was able to keep her cool and patiently teach Korra one step at a time. Soon she was smoothly driving laps around the track, chatting up with Asami, really getting to know her.

It warmed Bolin's heart to see them getting along so well.

"Thank you Bolin." Noataka said with a small but warm smile.

He blinked in surprise at her sudden comment "For what?"

"For coming into Asami's life the way you did." she explained as she watched her young mistress drive by, Asami was laughing along with Korra at likely some joke they shared with one another. "It does my heart good to know that she has finally found real friends."

Bolin at first couldn't believe that someone as amazing as Asami didn't have friends, but as he thought about it he understood. With her vast wealth and incredible beauty most people must've felt like they weren't worthy to even be in her presence, he certainly felt that way when he first met her. And anyone she would normally associate with were likely stuck up rich folks who felt like they were better then everyone else, and that's not to say of any young men she met before. Only thinking about how to get it in with the gorgeous daughter of Hiroshi Sato.

Just think about all these shallow people made him sick.

"I'm glad to see you understand." she said snapping him out of his thoughts.

"What are you-"

"You make the exact same face I make whenever I think about all the other people Asami has had to meet over the years." she said while pointing at the deep frown he currently had. She then turned back to see the happy face of her mistress drive by again. "I honestly haven't seen her this happy in a long time. Not since.."

Her face turned grim as dark memories filled her mind "Lady Yasuko's death was hard on all of us. She gave me a home, a family when I had nothing. The only thing Asami inherited from her father was his knack for machines. But her kindness, her beauty in both body and soul, all came from the woman who became like a sister to me."

Bolin was getting a little scared right now cause even though Noataka's face was calm her light blue eyes blazed with righteous fury. "And she was taken away from us all because of a man so consumed by greed he was willing to murder, all for the sake of getting a few yuans." she hissed with a voice colder then the arctic depths.

In fact the air around them felt like it dropped at least 10 degrees, Bolin swore he could see his own breath.

But Noataka was able to reign in her wrath by taking a deep breath, exhaling a chilling mist. "Ever since that day Mr.Sato buried himself in his work to escape his grief, while I had to step in and take care of a little girl who's entire world crumbled all in one night. And I would do it all again a thousand time over. Asami is like the daughter I've never had. I can only hope that Yasuko is proud of the woman I raised in her place."

"She would be very proud." Bolin said with utmost confidence. "If Asami really is anything like her mother, then she would tell you that you did an amazing job. And I bet if you ever had kids of your own, you would be a fantastic mother."

Noataka had to admit, hearing him say that with such certainty made her heart skip a beat. She smiled at the young man softly "That's very kind of you to say." She then approached him and placed her hands on his shoulders, looking at him with moist eyes. "Bolin, should anything happen to me, please take care of her." she pleaded.

He felt his heart stop at seeing such a normally composed woman so vulnerable, but he gave her the most determined look he could a said with all the strength he could muster "I promise I will."

She wrapped her arms around him with strong but trembling arms "Thank you." she whispered sincerely. She truly felt reassured when she felt his own powerful arms return her embrace.

"What's going on here?" asked a confused Asami with Korra looking just as puzzled at the scene in front of them.

Noataka broke the hug and wiped the tears from her eyes while giving her surrogate daughter a soft smile "It's nothing to be concerned about." she said with her normal professional tone.

(The next day at Air Temple Island)

Bolin blinked in puzzlement at the strange but adorable sight in front of him. Ikki and Meelo were pretending to drive rather fancy new Satomobile with a pink bow on it's hood. "So..where's-"

"Korra practicing over that way! Now get out the way, the police are gaining on us!" Ikki exclaimed.

"You'll never take us alive!" Meelo shouted at the imaginary cops behind them.

Bolin chucked at their game and head towards his girlfriend in the middle of training. "Nice new ride. I think Naga's going to be jealous though." he joked.

"Ha! Like that hunk of junk has got anything on Naga!" Korra jested in in kind as she went through some Airbending forms.

"But seriously, what with the new car?"

"It's a 'gift' from Councilman Tarrlok. He's been sending all kinds of things to try and get me to join a task force he's recruiting for to take down Amon."

"What?! But Amon is a good guy, or well girl, why would he think she needs to be hunted? I mean, I get that she is scary, but she not a threat to the innocent."

"You don't know that for sure Bolin. Nobody knows who she really is. Why does she wear a mask? What does she have to hide in the shadows? And why make such a big spectacle out of taking someones Bending away? Those sound like the actions of someone with something sinister planned. All that big talk about making the world a better place could be a lie to cover up her real plans."

When she puts it like that, he could understand where she is coming from and could even agree somewhat. But he saw the truly kind side of Amon, behind all the shadows and speeches. When she had no reason to think he wasn't with The Triple Threats she didn't just disregard his pleas of innocence, instead she listened, search for proof and when she found it she let him go, no strings attached. She even offered him safe harbor for the night.

Plus he got the feeling that Korra wasn't being completely rational in her judgement of Amon.

"Well maybe-"

"Avatar Korra!"

Their conversation was cut in by Tarrlok's secretary approaching them with a polite smile "I have something for you."

"It doesn't matter how many gifts Tarrlok sends, I'm not joining his task force!" Korra said as she used Earthbending to spin him around and kick him in the butt.

"It's not a gift. It's an invitation." the secretary said keeping a professional tone as he held a pamphlet.

"To what?" she asked curiously as she swiped the pamphlet.

"Councilman Tarrlok is holding a gala in your honor. All of Republic City's movers and shakers will be there. The Councilman humbly requests your attendance."

Korra had a thoughtful frown as she looked at the pamphlet as it explained all the details, including the fact that she could invite a plus one. She looked to Bolin to see what he thought about this, but he just shrugged as to say it was up to her. She decided..

1151312311222111241321.content:
Korra, Bolin and the rest of The Airbending Family were dressed in their finest clothes as they entered Tarrlok's mansion where he was hosting his gala. A crowd of some of the most influential people in the city gave a polite applause as the guest of honor arrived.

"I can't believe this is all for me." Korra said with slight awe.

Tenzin however was not so impressed "I'm not sure what Tarrlok is plotting, but keep your guard up. It's not like him to throw a party for the fun of it." he said seriously, bringing down her chipper mood a little.

Bolin wrapped his arm around her shoulder to reassure her "Oh relax Tenzin, it's party. We can still have a little fun." he said with casual enthusiasm. But then he noticed Meelo standing on a table near a punch bowl, pulling his pants down "Though you might want to stop Meelo from..spiking the punch."

Tenzin turned to face where Bolin was looking and panicked at what his son was about to do. "No Meelo! That is not a Toilet!" he exclaimed while running off to stop the little Airbender from peeing in the punch bowl.

Bolin and Korra shared a laugh at Tenzin's plight "I don't think Meelo will be coming to more parties anytime soon after this." Korra said amused.

"A shame. Kid's the life of the party." Bolin joked.

"Bolin! Korra!" said a familiar voice. They turned around to see Asami walking up to them wearing the same dress she on her date with Bolin. "I'm glad you could make it. You guys are some of the only people I can really talk to." she said with a slightly tired smile.

"Good to see you again." Korra said happy to see her new friend as well. She notice someone missing though "Where's Noataka? Isn't she like supposed to be like your shadow or something?"

"Oh she's around somewhere, hiding. She always does this whenever we go to gatherings like this." she said used to her attendant's mysterious behavior. "But if I ever really need her she'll come running."

Bolin and Korra looked around to see if the could spot the elusive butler, but saw neither hide or hair of her.

"Yeah don't bother. If she doesn't want to be seen then you'll never find her." Asami said amused.

"That's..kind of creepy." Korra said a little freaked out.

"Tell me about it." her boyfriend agreed.

"So glad you could make it Avatar Korra." Tarrlok said with practiced flattery as he approahed his guest of honor. "If you'll please excuse us, the city awaits it's hero." he said gesturing her to follow him.

Korra looked up to Bolin apologetically, but he gave her an understanding smile "Go get 'em." She smiled gratefully at him and kissed his cheek sweetly before she followed the councilman to shake hands and make headlines with the big shots of the city.

Despite understanding why she needed to go Bolin was still pretty bummed that he wasn't able to spend as much time as he would've liked. He felt Asami place a comforting hand on his shoulder and she gave him a sympathetic smile, which he very much appreciated.

"Hey, why don't you come with me and meet The Airbenders?" Bolin asked while offering his arm for her to hold.

She smiled and gently took hold of his offered arm "I would love to."

Tenzin was in the middle of scolding his son for nearly peeing in the punch bowl as they approached him. He paused when he noticed the young couple before turning back to Meelo "We will talk about this more when we get home young man." he said sternly. He then took a deep breath and put on a polite smile "Ah, you must be Ms.Sato. Bolin has talked much about you."

"Only good things I hope." she said in good humor.

"You're pretty. Can I have some of your hair?" Meelo asked innocently.

An awkward silence filled the group as nobody could knew what to say at that. Though let's be glad Meelo was 5 and didn't really know any better otherwise that would've REALLY been creepy.

"Meelo perhaps we should go find mommy? Excuse us." Tenzin said with an awkward smile as he escorted his son away.

"Until we meet again beautiful woman!" Meelo said happily waving goodbye.

Bolin and Asami gave each other a look before sharing a laugh at the sheer randomness of that whole exchange. "Kids." Bolin shrugged.

"Bolin!" Ikki cheerfully cried out as she ran up to meet them with her big sister in tow.

"Ikki! Jinora!" Bolin cheered in kind as he scooped up the two Airbenders in a warm hug. "How are my two favorite girls doing?" he asked warmly as he placed them back on the ground.

"You say that and yet you also have Korra and Asami." Ikki said accusatory. "Which of us are really your favorite girls?" she asked with narrow eyes.

"Uh.." Bolin was really put on the spot and had no idea what to say.

"Ikki knock it off." Jinroa said coming to his rescue. "You know he's dating Korra right now. And we are far too young to be dating anyone anyway."

"Yeah, but you would like to date Bolin wouldn't you?" Ikki asked her sister.

Jinora face turned completely red at her insinuation "NO I WOULDN'T!!" she strongly denied.

"And what does Bolin dating Korra have to do with him not dating Asami?"

"Ikki, how many times do I have to tell you? Open relationships are only accepted among Airbenders! Everywhere else is is monogamous!"

"Well that's stupid! Asami clearly likes Bolin and you like Bolin, so why can't you guys all be happy together?"

"Because that just how the world works! And for the last time I do not like Bolin!"

"Liar!"

As the sister continued to bicker all Bolin could do was give a confused Asami a sheepish grin "Hehehe..kids am I right?"

Asami's confusioned look turned mischievous "Actually, I would like to who your two favorite girls really are myself." she said with a smirk as she leaned into him, making sure his muscular arm was buried between her full breasts.

Bolin was speechless at her boldness and his brain shut down at feeling her soft assets against him [Their softer then Korra's.] he thought in awe.

But before he could even think about forming a response the flashes of many cameras and reporters asking questions drew their attention to the stairs as Korra was about to give her answers to the press on how she plans to deal with Amon.

choices: Korra vs Amon! Who will win?! Place your bets!
11513123112221112413212.content:
"Avatar Korra, you witnessed Amon take peoples bending away first hand." stated a male reporter. "Even though she claims it's to protect the innocent from those who would abuse their power, can you confidently say that Amon won't abuse this power herself and use it on the people she claims to protect?"

Korra nervously cleared her throat "I think..that Amon can't be trusted with that kind of power." she said with little confidence.

Tarrlok smiled smugly behind her, thinking that it was only a matter of time before Korra backed herself into a corner and fell right into his hands. Meanwhile Tenzin was hoping that Korra could find a way out of the mess she unwittingly found herself in, while Bolin and Asami weren't sure what to think and could only hope that Korra knew what she was doing.

"Then why have you refused to join Tarrlok's task force?" another reporter asked. "As the Avatar shouldn't you be going after Amon if you think she is a threat?"

"Well..I.." she wasn't sure what to say and the cameras flashing in her eyes certainly didn't help get her thoughts together.

"Why are you backing away from this fight?" the same reporter asked.

"What?!" she asked with slight indignation. "No, I have never back away from anything in my life!"

But even as she said that, the cameras kept flashing and the questions got more personal.

"You promised to serve this city, are you going back on that promise now?"

"Do you think Pro-Bending is more important then keeping the peace?"

"How do you think Avatar Aang would have handled this?"

"Are you afraid of Amon?"

That was the last straw.

"I am not afraid of anybody!" Korra declared for everyone to hear."But I'll tell you who is really afraid, Amon! If she was any real hero then she wouldn't always be hiding in the shadows like a coward! So get this message out to every paper and broadcast it from every radio in the city! Amon, I challenge you to a duel! No task force, no chi-blockers, just the two of us tomorrow night at midnight on Avatar Aang Memorial Island! Let's cut to the chase and settle this once and for all! If you have the guts to face me!"

With that declaration she stormed her way down the stairs and through the crowd of reporters all hoping to get another comment, but she ghosted them and left the party in a huff.

"Korra wait!" Tenzin cried out running up to his young charge. "Korra this madness!" he said sternly

"Don't try to stop me!" she said stubbornly "This is something I have to do Tenzin. And I have to do it alone."

"No you don't." Bolin said strongly as he walked up to his girlfriend with Asami in tow.

"Bolin don't-"

"I made a promise to help you face any danger you would encounter as the Avatar, even if it meant facing the end of the world. And that is a promise I intended to keep." he stated resolutely.

Korra could feel her heart about to burst with love as she saw the strength in his green eyes, he really meant every word he said.

"And I'm coming too." Asami said suddenly.

"What?!" Korra blinked in surprise. "Why would you-"

"You guys are the only real friends I've ever had. There is no way I'm letting you face this alone." the upper class lady said with conviction.

Korra found herself moved by her new friend's loyalty. "But I said I would face Amon alone."

"You exact words were 'No task force, No chi-blockers.' You never said anything about 'No friends.'" Bolin pointed out.

"Besides, who's to say Amon will even honor that whole 'No chi-blocker' rule?" Asami added "You need to be ready for anything."

"And we won't get in the way of you facing Amon, we will just be there to stop her from trying anything funny." Bolin finished. Even though he did trust Amon more then most he wouldn't put it passed her to stack the odds in her favor.

Korra had to admit, they both made good points. And she could see that she couldn't talk them out of it, so she figured it's best just to accept it. "Alright. I'll be counting on you two." she said gratefully

"We won't let you down!" Bolin shouted with a salute, making the girls chuckle at how seriously he was taking this.

Meanwhile Tenzin watched the whole exchange bemused. He was suppose to try and talk Korra out of going through with this crazy plan of hers, but as he quickly learned when dealing with Korra when she made up her mind about something it was almost impossible to change it. All you can do in the end is be there for her when she either triumphs or fails, but as he looked at the friends she made since coming here, he found himself surprisingly optimistic.

(Tomorrow. Near midnight.)

The press did their job as every newspaper and every radio in the city was talking up the upcoming duel between Korra and Amon. They were saying it could possibly be the most epic duel the world had ever seen since Aang vs Ozai. You would've had to be blind, deaf, dumb and living under a rock to have not of heard about this fight. So naturally Mako caught wind of this and tried to talk his brother out of it, and when that didn't work he then said he was coming too. He would not let his little brother walk into a Sabertooth-Moose-Lion's den alone if he could help it.

And so Korra stood with her friends on top of the memorial building waiting for the clock to strike 12. Korra thought she saw something move from the corner of her eye, so she got into a fighting stance with everyone else following suit. But it didn't seem that anything was there so they relaxed there guard, only to all jump at once when the clock ringed, signaling that it was now midnight.

The team all took in a deep breath to steel themselves for the fight ahead. And this time everyone saw something at the corner of their eye and they turned to face the masked vigilante herself stepping out from behind one of the statues feet.

"I received your invitation, young Avatar." Amon stated calmly "Though I was under the impression you wanted to face me alone."

"And I will." Korra retorted with as much courage as she could muster. "My friends are here just in case you decided play dirty."

"Hmm..preparing for the inevitable fact that your enemies will not fight fair. There just maybe hope for you yet." the masked woman said honestly impressed. "Then I hope if you don't mind if I brought a few friends of my own."

As if they were summoned from The Spirit World 12 Equalists ambushed Korra's friends. And in the blink of an eye they had their chi blocked and were brought to their knees in submission holds.

Korra tried to come to their aid, but she was stopped by a bola with a rope warping around her ankles. Her feet were pulled out from under her and she was dragged towards Amon, but Korra broke free with a flaming hand stand kick.

Korra got into her fighting stance and glared hatefully at Amon "You are going to pay for that." she hissed.

"We shall see." said Amon not fazed in the slightest.

They stared each other down for a minute and as if to add more dramatic weight to this duel rain started to fall. And with a flash of lightning and roar of thunder the two heroes clashed!
11513123112221112413212.title: I challenge you to a d-d-d-duel!

115131231122211124132121.content:
Korra made the first move by unleashing a ferocious barrage of fire punches and kicks, as well as tossing in some earth bullets for good measure. Amon effortlessly bobbed and weaved between the flames and rock launched her way and responded to Korra's attack by throwing a set of throwing knifes. Korra back flipped to dodge the blades, but this left her open for Amon to catch her mid air with two bolas which wrapped around her arms and ankles.

As the young Avatar struggled to escape her binds Amon quickly closed the distance between them and place a thumb on Korra's forehead, which made her and her friends freeze in horror. Amon kept her thumb there for a good few seconds before pure frantic instinct took hold of Korra which gave her the strength to tear apart the bolas and attack with reckless fiery abandon.

Her wild strikes were powerful, but left her wide open and her fear clouded mind allowed Amon take advantage as she flowed through the chaotic elemental barrage to sweep kick her legs and pine her to the floor on her back with a knife near her throat.

"That is two times in the span of a minute that if I really wanted to, I could have either taken your Bending or your life." Amon explained menacingly as the rain began to change to a down pour. "Be thankful I do not view you as an enemy, otherwise you would have gone down in history as the youngest Avatar to have ever died. And all before you had ever really accomplished anything." she taunted as she slowly brought the knife from Korra's throat to her left cheek and used the tip to leave a small but deep cut.

Korra's anger was able to overpower her fear as she let out a powerful breath of fire causing Amon to jump off her lest she suffer terrible burns. She then sent out a couple more fire balls to follow up, but the rain quickly snuffed them out. "Firebending in the rain, not very smart of you." the masked woman taunted.

Korra growled in frustration, but it quickly turned to smug satisfaction as she realized that she now had the upper hand. "True, but Waterbending in the rain is another story!" she said with a triumphant smirk as she summoned all the water around her to forum octopus tentacles.

From then on the battle completely turned to Korra's favor as all Amon could do was dodge Korra's never ending watery assault. From using her octopus technique to both attack and defend, to launching a literal hail of ice daggers, to sending a tidal wave crashing towards the masked fighter and more. Amon had to use every bit of her seemingly inhuman agility to stay in the fight.

This continued for a minute until Korra was able to sneak in a little ice on the floor which tripped Amon up and allowed Korra to trap her in an ice prison. "Ha! Not so tough now are you!" taunted the smug Avatar.

"All right! Go Korra!" Bolin cheered from the sidelines.

"Don't go celebrating just yet." warned one of the equalists pinning him. "Amon's is far from finished."

Korra turned her attention towards the lackeys that held her friends captive "Yeah right! I got her right where I want her! And once I'm done with her your..next..?" Her threat lost it's strength as her left arm fell to her side, numb. "What's-"

"That would be the paralysis agent taking effect." Amon explained, seemingly not fazed by her freezing confinement.

"Paralysis?! When would you have..wait.." Korra replayed the battle so far in her head until she found the answer "The knife!"

"Yes." Amon confirmed "Laced with Shirshu saliva, just enough to cause numbness for a few minutes. It normally takes longer to take effect, but with how fast your blood is no doubt pumping through your veins from this battle it's much more fast acting."

"YOU CHEATING BITCH!!" Korra screamed in rage as she tried to launch a fire fist, but the agent had spread to her leg, throwing her of balance and sending her to her knees.

"On the contrary, this duel was staked in your favor from the very beginning." Amon retorted "If being able to wield all the elements wasn't enough, I knew it was going to rain at this time of night, there for giving you an even greater advantage. Also.." the ice prison around her melted rapidly, revealing a shocking fact.

"You're a Waterbender?!" Korra exclaimed in astonishment "You mean this whole time you've been-"

"Holding back? Yes. And those men who have your friends at my mercy? They are actually some of my newest recruits. They have been under my direct tutelage for only 6 weeks. The only advantage they had on their side was surprise and numbers. If your friends had been more alert, then they would've been able to best them easily."

"Why are you telling me all this?!" Korra asked frantically, doing everything she can just to stay on her feet.

"To teach you just how woefully unprepared you are to face the cruelty, the insanity, the pure evil that plagues this city." Amon stated with overwhelming authority. "You are highly skilled and well trained Korra, but there are people in this world who are willing to do anything to kill you, to make you and those you love suffer. Observe."

Amon unbutton her uniform to reveal not only a well toned, curvy body fit for a warrior, but also the dozens upon dozens of scars from the many battles she faced over the years fighting the dark underworld of Republic City. Scars from knifes, burns, puncher wounds in her ribs, and that was only from what they could see from her torso. She no doubt had many more all over her body, this woman had been through hell.

Korra and her friends were horrified at this gruesome sight, many of those wounds made them wonder how it was possible that this woman was even still alive.

"I have face horrors you can't imagine, I have nearly died countless times. And the only reason I am still fighting, the only reason I am still alive is because I have someone so precious to me that I am willing to do anything to protect them. Someone I am willing to die for, so they can have a better future. Where as the worst you have ever faced is some common thugs off the street and a few athletes in a safe, regulated sport. You may be The Avatar, but take that away and what are you hm?"

Korra was in tears as she fell to knees powerless in the face of her greatest fear, not Amon, although she was a close second, but an even greater fear. A fear that the masked hero could see all too clearly.

"I'll tell you what you are..nothing. Just a scared young woman who is way in over her head. A naive child who wants to do good, but has no idea what she is doing. Someone who doesn't even deserve the incredible power she wields. A girl who if she wasn't the Avatar, nobody would need her. Or even care about her."

"THAT"S NOT TRUE!!!" Bolin roared as he almost broke free from the Equalists holding him him down.

"We blocked his chi! How is he this strong?!"

"I don't love you because you're The Avatar Korra, I love you because you're brave, kind, headstrong, beautiful, you don't take crap from anybody, you can dance and burp with the best of them and so much more! There have been many Avatars, but there has never been one like you Korra! You are one of a kind and I love you!" he cried out with all his might as he slowly, but surely was able to break free and fight the amateur Equalists with sheer brute strength fueled by the power of love.

"You are the most stubborn and frustrating woman I have ever met!" Mako said passionately as he was able to use the shock of the Equalists caused by his brother to break out of his own pinned position. "But you are also the best thing to ever happen to my brother! I have never seen him more happy in his life then when he's with you! So don't you dare disrespect his love for you by giving up now!" he chastised as he joined his brother in laying the smack down.

"You are one of the only people outside of my family that I ever made a real connection with!" Asami confessed as years of self-defense lessons kicked into high gear as she gave one the Equalists a backwards headbutt, causing him to loosen his grip and allowing her to get the leverage she needed to throw the other over her shoulder. "We may have not been friends for long, but you didn't care about my wealth or status and that means more to me then you could ever realize! Avatar or not, you are my friend Korra and you always will be!"

Korra felt happiness she never thought could exist as she witness her friends fight with skill and spirit she had only heard of in stories.

"A truly moving sight indeed." Amon said honestly impressed at the display. But she steeled her heart for what needed to be done. "However.." with a few gestures the young heroes were quickly all pinned together in ice, she then formed an ice sword.

Korra's eyes widened in terror "NO!! PLEASE DON'T!!" she screamed in desperation trying to fight through the numbness. But Amon did not head her as she charged with sword in hand intent a 3-way execution. "NOOO!!!"

With every last bit of strength she had she threw a punch that blast not fire, water or earth, but for the first time in her life a blast of air so powerful it not only hit Amon, but it blasted her clear off the building.

Everyone was in awe, but none more so then Korra as she looked at her fist in disbelief "I can Airbend? I can Airbend!" she roared in triumph as she let loose more air blasts Equalists. At seeing how outmatched they were they fled the scene. With one threat out of the way she freed her friends to help finish this once and for all.

The team found Amon laying on the ground seemingly in defeat, but not taking any chances Korra bended an earth prison around the masked woman, leaving only her head free.

She then pulled down her hood and took off her mask "Alright Amon let's see..who you..really are.."

Nobody could believe the true identity of Amon, but their she was clear as day with a proud smile on her face.

"Well fought Korra."

"NOATAKA?!?!"
115131231122211124132121.title: Clash of heroes! The true face of fear!

1151312311222111241321211.content:
"But you..how..where..when..What!?" Bolin stuttered in complete confusion, basically summing up the same thoughts everyone else had at this revelation.

"I understand this is a lot to take in." Noataka stated calmly despite her compromising position "But I assure you, I can explain everything."

"In that case, please explain why you tried to kill us!!" Asami demanded filling utterly betrayed by the one person she trusted above all others.

"None of you were in any real danger. In the event that Korra had failed to do anything to save you, then I would've simply made the ice blade melt when I followed through on my swing. Everything I did was a means to test you, to see if any of you were ready."

"Ready for what?" asked Mako.

"War." she stated heavily.

A feeling of great dread washed over the young heroes, they looked among themselves with eyes full of worry before turning their attention back to Noataka. "What do you mean? What war?" asked Korra.

"A war that has been brewing in this city for years, a war that I may have inadvertently caused." she said with great shame. "When I first began my mission I did so alone. My intention was to become an entity that could strike fear into the hearts of even the coldest, blackest hearts of the most hardened criminals. Much like how parents use stories of Koh The Face Stealer to get their children to behave, I wanted the mere mention of my name to be a powerful crime deterrent. And for a time I succeeded, crime was dropping, the streets were safe to walk at night and the people were happy."

"But that didn't last long huh?" Bolin asked understanding were this story was going.

"No. It wasn't long before criminals became smarter in their activities, more ruthless in their methods. They formed alliances and developed counter strategies for my skills. And no matter what I did to evolve my skills or upgrade my arsenal, I soon devolved from being crimes worst nightmare, into nothing more then a constant annoyance. Much like the police."

Judging from all the scars she showed them earlier she wasn't kidding. It started to make sense why Amon was so terrifying and ruthless, she had to be in order to not only fight crime, but just to stay alive.

"I quickly realized that if I was to have any real hope in my war on crime I needed help. I started out small, with only one man I could trust at my side. Then more joined the fight and as the years pasted I soon became the leader of a small, but highly skilled army who's sole purpose was to protect the weak and fight evil." she said with a small smile, remembering brighter times. But then her face turned grim again "Or at least..that was the idea."

"Despite all of our success, many of my followers started to believe I was too soft in my methods. They said that I wasn't going far enough, that so long as criminals always had their Bending they would never stop terrorizing the helpless. They even started to believe that Bending in of itself is the root of all evil and that we need to simply get rid of Benders all together. That is why I created my technique to permanently take someones Bending, to not only take power away from those who abuse it, but to keep my more extreme followers in line."

"That reminds me." Korra interjected "How do you take someones bending away anyway?"

This was a question that everyone wanted the answer to. And for a brief moment Noataka was very reluctant to tell them one of her darkest secrets, but deep down she knew that if she was ever going to get them to trust her, especially Asami, they needed to know the truth. She took in a deep breath to steel herself "I use Bloodbending."

This answer left everyone stunned.

Bolin:Say what?!

Mako:No way..

Asami:I don't believe it.

"That's impossible! It wasn't a full moon that night!" Korra pointed out in denial.

"Bare in mind Korra, that the art of Bloodbending itself was once believed to be an impossible skill." Noataka reminded "The same with Metalbending. And generating lightning was an ability once only know to those of Fire Nation royalty. With enough time, practice and talent any skill can be learned, created and improved."

"Wow. That is deep." Bolin said with awe.

"As I said at The Revelation, I studied Bending and how it works for years. Through my research I discovered how the chakras in ones body can influence how all of ones chi flows. If even one of these chakras is damaged, then ones chi becomes impossible to use, thus taking away their Bending."

"Okay, but there's something that I still don't get." said Mako puzzled "Why go to this extreme to fight crime instead of joining the police?"

Asami's eyes widened as the answer became clear "It because of what happened to mom..isn't it?" she asked softy.

Noataka's eyes were filled with silent tears at the mention of her surrogate sister "Yes."

"And that's how your face got burned too. You hunted the man who killed her."

"Yes."

"You mean that scar on her cheek?" Bolin asked.

"It used to be so much worse. Nearly her whole face was burned." Asami said with grimace at remembering the horrid sight of her attendant's injury. "My dad spent a small fortune on facial reconstruction surgery to heal her. Most of the damage was healed, but only physically. Psychologically however.." she fell silent at the memory of how scary Noataka was on her road to recovery.

"I was in a dark place, to say the least." Noataka finished for her mistress. "I was sent to the North Pole to receive physical and mental therapy from Master Katara. She had to use every bit of her skill, wisdom and patience to heal not only my damaged face, but my damaged mind. I spent many of those grueling months denying her treatment, spitting in her face, cursing her and every other Bender. Saying things like how the only thing Bending has brought to the world is suffering and she should just die. I have even attempted to take my own life." she said full of guilt and hurt.

Asami was in tears herself as she now understood all the pain the Noataka had to suffer alone. Korra feeling empathy for the both of them and know Noataka wasn't a threat she Bended the earth prison away so that the two of them could embrace. Bolin was weeping like a baby as he gave his own brother a hug at hearing the tragic story, which Mako returned. He then looked to Korra and offered her to join in which she accepted.

For a few minutes pain was shared and plenty of tears were shed, before Noataka was able to finish her tale.

"But in spite of all my misplaced anger and self loathing Master Katara only ever responded with kindness and understanding. She would tell me stories of her travels with Avatar Aang, of all the things she saw, the people she met and helped, of all the struggles she and her friends faced and even of her personal quest for revenge against the man who killed her mother. And every full moon she would use Bloodbending herself to help heal the rest of my injury. When I asked her why she would use a skill that she outlawed, said was evil she told me 'It took me many years to realize this truth, no skill is good or evil. All that matters is how we decide to use them. So the only question is Noataka, how will you decide to use your skills? It's all up to you.'"

"So I decide to use my skills to fight for a better future for the ones I love. But in doing so I fear I may have emboldened those who will use the skills I have taught them for their own ends. Ends which could endanger the lives of countless innocents. So I beg of you, all of you. Please help me fix my mistake and save the city. Help me protect what I love." she pleaded sincerely reaching out with her hand.

Korra smiled softly as she grabbed the veteran hero's hand "I will." she promised.

"So will I." Asami said placing her hand on top of theirs.

"We're in too." Bolin said boldly as he and his brother joined in.

"Thank you." Noataka said with great relief.

"Look out criminals of Republic City!" Bolin shouted out while pointing to the city "Cause The New Team Avatar is here!"

"YEAH!!" they all cheered.

(The next day at City Hall)

Korra stood at the podium with all her friends behind her as she looked out at the huge crowd waiting to hear her address about what happened on the island.

"I'll be completely honest with all of you. When I came to Republic City I thought if I just learned how to Airbend then I would be The Avatar I needed to be in order to bring balance and peace. I didn't realize just how much of my sense of identity was tailored to my Bending, to my title as The Avatar. And that it was the very thing that held me back from achieving my potential. But my duel with Amon taught me that it's not my ability to Bend all the elements that makes me The Avatar, but my desire to help people, to protect those precious to me and make the world a better place. And that is potential that exists in all of us, Bender and None-Bender alike. I understand now that I can't protect the city alone, I will need the help of my friends and all of you. So as I continue to learn to be a better Avatar, I encourage the people of this city to remember that you too have the power to make the world a better place. And it is only possible when we all stand together. Thank you."

She finished her speech with a humble bow and the people cheered at her inspiring words. She then felt familiar strong arms embrace her.

"Well said Korra." Bolin said with a proud smile.

3 weeks seemed to pass in the blink of an eye as The Fire Ferrets, aka Team Avatar, have dedicated nearly every waking moment of their lives to training for not only the championship tournament, but for the war that Noataka warned was coming. And with how tensions between Benders and None-Benders started to rise ever since Tarrlok created his task force it seemed she had very good reason to be worried.

Even though he would tell the public that Amon was dangerous and needed to be stopped, it was becoming clear that he was the dangerous one, as he was arresting people without due process just because he suspected them to be Equalists, without hard evidence. And anytime he actually made a legitimate arrest, like when he took down a secret chi-blocking training gym under a book store, it was in places that were once crime invested neighborhoods. But thanks to not only The Equalists direct actions did crime drop greatly in these neighborhoods, but the people also had the means to protect themselves, their homes and families thanks to what they learned.

If that wasn't bad enough every supposed unlawful thing he did was technically legal, thanks to the nearly unlimited power the council granted him when he created the task force. So even if someone like Chief Lin Beifong apposed any arrest he made, which she did, frequently, there was nothing she could do to stop him since he wasn't technically breaking the law. Worst of all is that no matter how much Tenzin tried to stop Tarrlok from getting more power he was outvoted every single time.

A task force headed by a power hungry Bender, brought in to law by a council comprised only of Benders, able to lawfully judge any None-Bender as a criminal and imprison them with impunity. This was giving Amon's more zealous followers plenty of reasons to revolt against her and start an Anti-Bending Revolution. The city had become a barrel of blasting jelly ready to blow, if something wasn't done about it soon the city would fall into absolute chaos.

Luckily Noataka did have a plan to not only prepare the young heroes for the worst, but also help ease tensions just enough so that a peaceful resolution could still be possible. With Pro-Bending being the most popular sport in the city, it was the one place were Benders and None-Benders could put aside there differences and enjoy the spirit of healthy competition. And with The Fire Ferrets quickly becoming everyone's favorite team with their underdog origins and sheer likability, then wining the championship was the perfect means to raise positive moral among the people and teach Team Avatar the skills they would need, like teamwork, for when they began real hero work.

Which brings us to our young heroes currently in the middle of an intense three-way sparing session as Bolin, Korra and Mako unleashed excellently executed attacks and defenses, all under the watchful eye of their new coach Noataka. Soon the young Benders each found openings in each others defense as Mako hit his brother with a curved fireball knocking him off his feet. But Bolin notice Korra's attention was focused on Mako so he launched an earth disk her way just before he hit the ground. The earth disk hit it's mark in her torso just as Korra launched a water bullet which blasted Mako in the head.

All three of them hit the floor at near the exact same time, but they just laughed it off, proud of each other for how much they had improved.

"Great work team." Noataka said with a proud smile. "As individuals you have improved by leaps and bounds..but now lets see how well you have improved as a unit." Her smile changed to a smirk as she got into her fighting stance.

The young Benders jumped back to their feet and got into formation and in perfect unison attacked their coach from all sides. Normally 3 against 1 would be unfair, but for someone like Noataka who has face far worse many times it was more unfair for The Ferrets. All she did was dodge, never raised a fist or fought back, but within minute The Ferrets were back on the ground panting in exhaustion.

"Well you didn't hit each other this time, so that's a good start." the veteran teased. She then turned serious "Just remember, in a real fight your enemies will use any means to get the upper hand, there are no rules or safety gear on the streets. When the time comes you can not hesitate or show mercy, your enemies will kill you if they get the chance. Do Not, give them that chance. Watch each others backs. Enhance each others strengths. Cover each others weaknesses. And most importantly, never give up."

Korra smirked "Good advise." She then sent out a sudden gust of wind that knocked Noataka of her feet. To which Bolin and Mako followed up with earth and fire one-two combo to knock her higher into the air. Korra then quickly finished with a hammer blow of water, slamming her to the ground and pinned her in place with ice. The Ferrets then quickly closed in with their respected elements at the ready for a finishing blow, but stopped just short of following through. "I think you forgot one crucial thing to remember.." Korra said smugly.

"Never let your guard down." Mako finished with just as much satisfaction at finally getting one up on their normally unbeatable mentor.

"Ferrets 1, Noataka..101. Man I really wanted to follow up with something cool there." Bolin said embarrassed.

"You'll get plenty of chances later sweety." Korra said compassionately to her boyfriend.

"Hahaha! Well played team!" Noataka said full of pride for her new students. She melted the ice around her and stood up "Alright now, huddle up." The team did so, looking at one another with pride in how far they've come and excitement for the matches ahead. "Your first match in the tournament is tonight. You may not have been a team for long, but I can safely say your one of the best teams I've ever seen. Your ready for this." she said sincerely "Do you feel ready?!"

"We're Ready/We're Ready/We're Ready!!"

"Not quite yet." Asami called out as she walked into the gym with a basket of new Pro-Bending uniforms "You'll need these." she said with a playful wink.

"Sweet!" Bolin cheered as he ran over to find his uniform "You managed to get my measurements right? It's really hard for me to find clothes able to fit all..this." he said while flexing his very impressive muscles.

Asami blushed at the display, but kept her composure "Yes, I made sure to put in a special order." she said playing along.

"Alright enough flirting you two." Korra casually interjected as she wrapped her arms around one of his biceps "We're having lunch with Tenzin's family in a hour, so if you will excuse us."

"Um..yeah we got to go. See ya later tonight guys." Bolin said nervously as his girlfriend escorted out. "You know I wasn't really flirting with Asami right?"

"I know. I was just teasing." she said knowingly. "I know you wouldn't ever cheat on me." she snuggled into his broad shoulder.

He sighed in relief and smiled warmly at her, happy with the fact she was so understanding. Little did either of them realize that Asami was watching them leave with pained, dare I say jealous look on her face.

She felt the comforting hand of Noataka on her shoulder, she looked to see her surrogate mother give her a sympathetic smile "You still have a crush on him, don't you?"

"No. Not anymore." she said honestly.

Noataka was surprised and a little confused, but as she notice the tears started to while in her mistresses eyes she understood. "I see. You love him don't you?"

"I tried to let it go. I can see that he's happy and I like Korra, their good for each other. I should be happy for them. But everyday it gets harder for me to see him in the arms of another woman. And I don't know what to do!" she confessed with a voice full of pain and confusion. "What do I do Noa?! Everyday it feels like my heart is being squeezed! I don't want to end up being bitter and hating them! What am I suppose to do?!" she cried out desperately as she buried her face into her attendant's chest.

All Noataka could do was wrap her arms around Asami "I don't know." she said with empathy.

From then on it was a full on free for all as Bolin, Korra and The Airbending Kids battled it out with snow, dirt, air ,fire and more in an intense, but fun brawl. All the while Tenzin and Pema watched on with fond smiles on their faces.

"They're having so much fun." Pema said with a little jealousy at the fact that her heavily pregnant state made it impossible for her to join the fun.

"Indeed." Tenzin said as he tenderly rubbed his wife's belly. He then realized something when he saw the huge smile beaming across Korra's face "I don't think I've ever seen Korra this happy before. And I think that might be the reason she has been struggling with her Airbending for so long." he theorized with stroking his beard.

"For nearly all her life Korra has know she was The Avatar, and while she has made it no secret at the fact that she loves being The Avatar, she has never really allowed herself to be anything else. Nearly every other Avatar that came before her has had a childhood from where which they didn't have to worry about shouldering the fate of the world. Even my father, who found out at a younger age then normal, had a carefree life, as every child should, before he learned of his destiny. A life of fun, freedom."

"Oh..I see." Pema said with understanding.

"Where as all of Korra's life has been preparing her for her duties as The Avatar, a life full of training, responsibility and sacrifice. The only things she ever did in any spare time she had was riding on her Polar Bear-Dog and even more training. She only ever got to see her own parents a few times every year." he said with regret "And I had the gall to lecture her about embracing freedom when I was one of the people who took it away from her."

"Don't be so hard on yourself honey." she said compassionately. "Don't forget that Korra made the choice to reveal herself as The Avatar and jumped head first at the opportunity to train. Just as Aang long ago made the choice to run away from his duties when he learned he was The Avatar. They both made choices that neither had any way of knowing the consequences, but in the end things are the way they should be. If Aang never ran away, then he never would have met Katara or any of his friends. Which means you would have never been born and I never want to think about what my life would be like without you in it. And sure for awhile Korra couldn't Airbend, but now she is making great strides in her training and discovering things about herself by the day. And look.." she said while pointing at Korra's direction.

Tenzin followed his wife's finger to see that the snowball war had ceased with no clear winner, but Jinora was still chasing after her sister to make her pay for reading her diary. Meanwhile Meelo was all tuckered out from the battle, so Bolin and Korra decided to take a nap with the little guy. "You see that smile on her face? That's the smile of a woman who is right where she belong, in the arms of her soulmate. So don't worry my love, all is right with the world." she finished with her usual gentle smile.

Tenzin smiled warmly at his wife gave her a tender kiss which she happily returned "And people say I'm the wise one." he said with good humor.

"Well I like to think I learned a thing or two from you over the years." she responded in kind.

"Pro-Bending champions for the last 3 years." Asami added with a slight edge. For if there was one team in Pro-Bending she truly didn't like, it would be the Wolf-Bats. They not only defeated most of their opponents, but left many of them hospitalized, especially the rookie teams. And to add insult to injury, they won most of their matches with One Round Knockouts. "Well well well, if it isn't The Fire Ferrets. Pro-Bending saddest excuse for a team." he with condescension practically oozing from his tone. "Tell me, how did a bunch of amateurs like you luck your way into the tournament?"

"And you must be Bolin. The idiot that everyone can't shut up about since the match with The Tiger-Dillo's. I've been hearing all kinds of things about you since then, one of them being that you're somehow dating The Avatar here." he gestured to Korra with a stare like he saw a fine piece of meat.

Korra just gave him a very unimpressed grunt and dirty look.

"Actually upon giving it a better look, I see now you couldn't pay someone enough to intentionally style that monstrosity." Bolin casually piled on. "So that means you style it yourself. Man, you have the fashion sense of a blind Skunk-Bear."

Tahno eye twitched in barely contained fury "You better be careful with your insults there rookie." he said seething.

"Dude, everything I just said was a fact. Cause there exists no insult that I could possibly say to properly describe the utter tragedy that is your do. Seriously, I've been styling my own hair since I've been living off the streets. So either I have a hidden talent in hair style or you should never be allowed to hold a pair of scissors again, cause that thing you can somehow look at in the mirror everyday and say 'Yeah this looks good' is a crime against humanity. And let me tell you the dumpsters I had to crawl through to find food as a kid, the rotting and putrid things I've seen and smelled, absolutely pail in comparison to the creature that died and somehow attached itself to your head." the young Earthbender said completely straight faced.

Nearly the entire restaurant erupted in hysterical laughter at Bolin's unrelenting barrage of comments on Tahno hair. It took every once of willpower and self control that The Wolf-Bat had to not make The Fire Ferret suffer for his humiliation.

"Oh man, that was the hardest I've ever laughed in my life." Korra said as she gazed at her love with tender eyes "You, are one of a kind Bolin."

"Please, do go on. I enjoy praise." he said with his trademark cocky swagger.

(1 hour later)

We now find Bolin and Korra snuggling under a tree in the park with Naga napping nearby.

"This is nice." Bolin said quietly "With all that been happening lately we haven't had much quality alone time together."
